slots.port: The port connect to when sending this request
slots.httpMethod: The HTTP method to be sent
slots.setHeader(name, value): Sets header with name to value
slots.host: The host to send this request to
slots.hasHeader(name): Returns true if this request has a header with name
slots.with(aUrl): Clones HCResponse and sets its state based on aUrl (HCUrl)

HCResponse.description: Stores the result of sending an HCRequest using an HCConnection

slots.headerAt(name): First header value associated with name

HCUrl.description A replacement for URL that d:
HCUrl with("http://www.apple.com/") get println
HCUrl with("http://www.apple.com/") getResponse statusCode println

slots.get: Creates an HCConnection based on this url, sends a request and returns the content of the response
slots.with(urlSeq): Returns a clone of HCUrl with its state set by parsing urlSeq
slots.getResponse: Creates an HCConnection based on this url, sends a request and returns the response

HCConnection.description: Sends an HCRequest using the HTTP protcol and stores the response in an HCResponse

slots.sendRequest: Send the request and set the response
slots.request: An HCRequest describing the HTTP request to be sent
slots.response: An HCResponse describing the response received from the remote host

LoudmouthMessage.description: LoudmouthMessage provides [[SGML]] interface with few convience methods for manipulation of XMPP messages.

slots.sendVia(loudmouthConnection): Converts message to sequence and sends it via the provided [[Loudmouth]] object. It updates from property and returns true if message is sent.
slots.setTo(jid): Sets message receiver to defined JID. JID can be both an [[Sequence]] or a [[JID]] object. Returns self.
slots.plainBody: Returns value of message's body node with XHTML markup.
slots.xmppType: Returns value of type attribute of message node.
slots.body: Returns value message's body node. If both XHTML and plain versions are available, XHTML version will be returned.
slots.with(source): Creates new [[LoudmouthMessage]] based on source, which should be valid XML ([[Sequence]]).

XmppChatMessage.description: A convience object for creating XMPP messages with chat type.

slots.create: Creates a new [[LoudmouthMessage]] of chat type and random id value.

JID.description:
Object for representing JIDs. 

j := JID with("cow@moo.com/Alpes")
j username == "cow"
j host == "moo.com"
j resource == "Alpes"
j asString == "cow@moo.com/Alpes"

slots.asString: Converts JID to string with all available parts included.
slots.with(jid): Extracts all parts of a provided Sequence and returns new JID clone.

Loudmouth.description:
Loudmouth is an async XMPP library written in C. Example usage: 
acc := Loudmouth with("user@server.com", "super password") do(
  handleConnect = method(
    "Connected!" println)

  handleMessage = method(msg
    "#{msg from} > #{msg plainBody}" println
    body :=  msg plainBody

    if(body indexOf("#") == 0,
      body = doString(body) asString)

    # This way you can manipulate
    # XML nodes with SGML addon
    XmppChatMessage create\
      setPlainBody(body)\
      setTo(msg from)\
      sendVia(self)

    # or simply send the message (must be a Sequence)
    # (this is obviously faster)
    #self send(msg from, body))
)

acc connect
# Any Io code after this line won't be executed
# (unless called as Loudmouth callback or run in separate thread)
Loudmouth startMainLoop

slots.handleDisconnect: Slot called upon closing the connection with the server.
slots.sendRaw(body): Sends raw text over XMPP stream. Returns true if no errors occur.
slots.registerAccount(server, username, passwo: Registers a new account at XMPP server. Returns true or false.
slots.handleConnectFailure: Slot called when server is not reachable.
slots.disconnect: Disconnects from server and returns true if it succeeds.
slots.status:
Returns status connection. Possible return values are:
  • Loudmouth types CLOSED
  • Loudmouth types OPENING
  • Loudmouth types OPEN
  • Loudmouth types AUTHENTICATING
  • Loudmouth types AUTHENTICATED
slots.handleConnect: Slot called once connection is established.
slots.handleMessage(xmppMessage): Slot called when a message arrives via XMPP stream. xmppMessage is a LoudmouthMessage object.
slots.handleSslFailure: Slot called if SSL-related problems arrive. Method should return true if it wishes to make a connection without SSL, false otherwise.
slots.send(toJid, message): Sends a message (Sequence) to provided JID (Sequence). Returns true or false.
slots.types:
Object containing status codes and message types.


  Loudmouth with("username@server.com", "password") do(
    handleConnect = method(
      self setPresence(Loudmouth types AVAILABLE), "Drinking lemonade...")
  )
slots.with(jid, password): Creates a new Loudmouth clone with server details provided in jid.
slots.handleAuthenticationFailure: Slot called if username/password combinaton is wrong.
slots.startMainLoop: Starts GMainLoop. Should be called after a connection is established with the server.

DNSQuery.description: An object representing an individual DNS query.

slots.addCoro(aCoro): Private method that adds a coro to coros.
slots.coros:
List of coroutines paused waiting for this query.
		These coros will be resumed when the query completes.
slots.resumeCoros: Resumes all the paused coros. <font color=red>Should this use resumeLater instead?</font>
slots.hostName: The host name which the query will request an IP for.
slots.waitOn: Pauses the calling coroutine until the query is completed.
slots.setHostName(aSeq): Sets the host name for the query.

slots.headerBreaks: Private method to connect to the host and write the header.
slots.unescapeString(aString): Returns a new String that is aString with the URL escape codes replaced by the appropriate characters.
slots.processHttpResponse(optionalProgressBloc: Private method that processes http response.
slots.referer: Returns the referer String or nil if not set.
slots.setURL(urlString): Sets the url string and parses into the protocol, host, port path, and query slots. Returns self.
slots.escapeString(aString): Returns a new String that is aString with the appropriate characters replaced by their URL escape codes.
slots.requestHeader: Returns a Sequence containing the request header that will be sent.
slots.fetchRaw: Fetch and return the entire response. Note: This may have problems for some request times.
slots.openOnDesktop: Opens the URL in the local default browser. Supports OSX, Windows and (perhaps) other Unixes.
slots.setResponseHeaderString(headerString): Private method that parses the responseHeaders.
slots.fetchToFile(aFile):
Fetch the url and save the result to the specified File object. 
	Saving is done as the data is read, which helps minimize memory usage. 
	Returns self on success or nil on error.
slots.fetch: Fetches the url and returns the result as a Sequence. Returns an Error, if one occurs.
slots.fetchWithProgress(progressBlock):
Same as fetch, but with each read, progressBlock is called with the readBuffer 
	and the content size as parameters.
slots.setRequest(requestString): Private method to set the url request.
slots.post(parameters, headers):
Sends an HTTP post message. If parameters is a Map, its key/value pairs are 
	send as the post parameters. If parameters is a Sequence or String, it is sent directly.
	Any headers in the headers map are sent with the request.
	Returns a sequence containing the response on success or an Error, if one occurs.
slots.stopFetch: Stops the fetch, if there is one. Returns self.
slots.parse: Private method to parse the url.
slots.with(urlString): Returns a new URL instance for the url in the urlString.
slots.clear: Private method to clear the URL's parsed attributes.
slots.fetchHttp(optionalProgressBlock): Private method that fetches an http url.

Server.description:
The Server object provides a simple interface for running a server. You just need to set the port and define a handleSocket method. Here's an example of an echo server: 
Echo := Object clone
Echo handleSocketFromServer := method(aSocket, aServer,
  write("[Got echo connection from ", aSocket host, "]\n")
  while(aSocket isOpen,
   if(aSocket read, aSocket write(aSocket readBuffer asString))
   aSocket readBuffer empty
  )
  write("[Closed ", aSocket host, "]\n")
)

write("[Starting echo server on port 8456]\n")
server := Server clone setPort(8456)
server handleSocket := method(aSocket,
  Echo clone @handleSocketFromServer(aSocket, self)
)
server start
Notes

Io's use of lightweight threading and select for dealing with sockets makes for servers that are much more efficient (both memory and cpu wise) than those written with kernel threads and socket polling.

slots.setPort(aNumber): Sets the port on which the server will listen  for connections. Returns self.
slots.handleSocket(aSocket):
This method is called when the server accepts a new socket. The new socket is passed as the argument.
	Override this method in your own server subclass. The default implementation raises an exception.
slots.port: Returns the port on which the server will listen for connections.
slots.stop: Stops the server if it is running. Returns self.
slots.start:
Starts the server. This method will not return until server is stopped, 
	so you may want to send the start message as an asynchronous message. 
	Returns self or an Error, if one occurs.
slots.setPath(path): Sets the path (for Unix Domain sockets) on which the server will listen  for connections. Returns self.

slots.waitOnOrExcept(timeout): Same as waitOn() but an exception is raised if a timeout occurs. Returns self.

IPAddress.description: Object representation of an Internet Protocol Address.

slots.setHostName(hostName):
Translates hostName to an IP using asynchronous DNS and 
	sets the host attribute. Returns self.

DNSServer.description: An object representing a DNSServer which DNS requests can be sent to.

slots.host: The host name (usually an IP) for the DNSServer.
slots.ipForHostName(hostName, timeout):
Sends a request to the DNS server, waits for a response and returns it. Will try 3 times if there are timeouts.
	Returns the IP (as a Sequence) if successful, raises an exception otherwise.
slots.setHost(aSeq): Sets the host name for the DNSServer.

slots.address:
Returns the IP address. A DNS lookup is done in the background if the 
	address is not already known. Returns an error on lookup failure.
slots.name: Returns name.
slots.setName(aString): Set's the host name. Return self.

EventManager.description:
Object for libevent (kqueue/epoll/poll/select) library. 
	Usefull for getting notifications for descriptor (a socket or file) events.
	Events include read (the descriptor has unread data or timeout) and write (the descriptor wrote some data or timeout).
	Also, timer and signal events are supported.

slots.run: Runs the EventManger loop. Does not return. Private - should only be called by resumeIfNeeded.

Socket.description:
Interface to network communication. Sockets will auto yield to other coroutines while waiting on a request. All blocking operations use the timeout settings of the socket. Reads are appended to the socket's read buffer which can be accessed using the readBuffer method. Example: 
	
socket := Socket clone setHost("www.yahoo.com") setPort(80) connect
if(socket error) then( write(socket error, "\n"); exit)

socket write("GET /\n\n")

while(socket read, Nop)
if(socket error) then(write(socket error, "\n"); exit)

write("read ", socket readBuffer length, " bytes\n")

slots.setPath(unixDomainPath): Sets the Unix Domain socket path for the socket. Returns self.
slots.setHost(hostNameOrIpString): Sets the host for the socket. Returns self on success, an Error object otherwise.
slots.readBytes(numBytes):
Reads the socket until its readBuffer is numBytes long, then returns a Sequence
	containing the first numBytes of readBuffer's contents and clips that section from the readBuffer.
slots.setHost(hostName):
Translates hostName to an IP using asynchronous DNS and sets 
the host attribute. Returns self.
slots.acceptTimeout: Returns the length of time in seconds for accept timeouts on the socket.
slots.errorNumber: Returns the socket error number for the last error.
slots.setBytesPerRead(numberOfBytes): Sets number of bytes to read per read call. Returns self.
slots.streamRead(numberOfBytes):
Reads numberOfBytes from the socket into the socket's readBuffer. 
	Returns self when all bytes are read or an Error object on error.
slots.writeMessage(aSeq):
Writes a 4 byte uint32 in network byte order containing the size of aSeq. 
	Then writes the bytes in aSeq and returns self.
slots.getSocketWriteLowWaterMark: Returns the write low water mark for the socket on success or nil on error.
slots.isValid: Returns true if the socket is in valid state, closes the socket and returns false otherwise.
slots.writeFromBuffer(optionalProgressBlock):
Writes the contents of the socket's writeBuffer to the socket. 
	If optionalProgressBlock is supplied, it is periodically called with the number of bytes written as an argument.
	Returns self on success or an Error object on error.
slots.port: Returns the port number for the socket.
slots.fromFd(descriptorId, addressFamily): Creates a new Socket with the low-level file descriptor (fd) set to descriptorId and it's address family (AF_INET or AF_UNIX) set to addressFamily.
slots.asyncStreamRead(aSeq, readSize):
Reads up to readSize number of bytes into aSeq if data is available. 
	Returns self immediately if successful. Returns an error object on Error. Returns nil if the socket is disconnected.
slots.asyncUdpRead(ipAddress, aSeq, readSize):
Reads up to readSize number of bytes from ipAddress into aSeq if data is available. 
	Returns self immediately if successful. Returns an error object on Error. Returns nil if the socket is disconnected.
slots.readUntilSeq(aSequence):
Reads the socket until its readBuffer contains aSequence, then returns a Sequence
	containing the readBuffer's contents up to (but not including) aSequence and clips that section from the readBuffer.
slots.setAddress(addressObject): Sets the address (IPAddress or UnixPath) for the socket. Returns self. For IP sockets the setHost() method should generally be used to set the host instead of this method. For Unix Domain sockets use the setPath() method.
slots.setBytesPerWrite(numberOfBytes): Sets number of bytes to write per write call. Returns self.
slots.setConnectTimeout(seconds): Sets the length of time in seconds for connect timeouts on the socket. Returns self.
slots.host: Returns the host for the socket.
slots.descriptorId: Returns the socket's file descriptor id as a Number.
slots.asyncListen: Listens to the socket and returns self immediately or an Error object on error.
slots.getSocketReadLowWaterMark: Returns the read low water mark for the socket on success or nil on error.
slots.udpRead(address, numBytes):
Waits for and reads numBytes of udp data from the specified address (IPAddress or UnixPath) into the socket's readBuffer.
	Returns self on success or an Error object on error.
slots.isOpen: Returns true if the socket is open, false otherwise.
slots.setReadTimeout(seconds): Sets the length of time in seconds for read timeouts on the socket. Returns self.
slots.appendToWriteBuffer(aSequence): Appends aSequence to the write buffer if it is non-nil. Returns self.
slots.readListMessage: A shortcut for List fromEncodedList(socket readMessage).
slots.setNoDelay: Sets the socket to be no-delay. Returns self on success or nil on error.
slots.asyncBind: Binds the socket and returns self immediately or an Error object on error.
slots.streamReadWhileOpen:
Reads the stream into the socket's readBuffer until it closes.
	Returns self on success or an Error object on error.
slots.setWriteTimeout(seconds): Sets the length of time in seconds for write timeouts on the socket. Returns self.
slots.address: Returns the address (IPAddress or UnixPath) object for the socket.
slots.connect: Connects to the socket's host. Returns self on success or an Error object on error.
slots.close: Closes the socket and returns self. Returns nil on error.
slots.streamReadNextChunk(optionalProgressBloc:
Waits for incoming data on the socket and when found, reads any available data and returns self. 
	Returns self on success or an Error object on error or timeout.
slots.asyncStreamOpen: Submits an async request to open the socket in stream mode and returns self immediately or an Error object on error.
slots.path: Returns the U for the socket.
slots.asyncStreamWrite(aSeq, start, writeSize):
Writes the slice of aSeq from start to start + writeSize to the socket.
	Returns self immediately if successful, otherwise closes the socket. 
	Returns an error object on Error. 
	Returns nil if the socket is disconnected.
slots.setSocketReadBufferSize(numberOfBytes): Sets the read buffer size for the socket. Returns self on success or nil on error.
slots.readMessage:
Empties the readBuffer and reads a 4 byte uint32 in network byte order. 
	This number is the number of bytes in the message payload which are 
	then read into the socket's readBuffer. The readBuffer is returned.
slots.setSocketWriteLowWaterMark(numberOfBytes: Sets the write low water mark for the socket. Returns self on success or nil on error.
slots.asyncConnect(addressObject): Connects to the given Address and returns self or an Error object on error.
slots.isStream: Returns true if the socket is a stream, false otherwise.
slots.udpReadNextChunk(address):
Waits to receive UDP data from the specified address (IPAddress or UnixPath). 
	As soon as any data is available, it reads all of it into the socket's readBuffer.
	Returns self on success or an Error object on error.
slots.errorDescription: Returns a description of the last error on the socket as a string.
slots.setAcceptTimeout(seconds): Sets the length of time in seconds for accept timeouts on the socket. Returns self.
slots.setSocketWriteBufferSize(numberOfBytes): Sets the write buffer size for the socket. Returns self on success or nil on error.
slots.serverWaitForConnection:
Waits for a connection or timeout. When a connection is received, this method returns the connection socket. 
	An Error object is returned on timeour or error.
slots.bytesPerRead: Returns number of bytes to read per read call.
slots.setPort(portNumber): Sets the port number for the socket, returns self.
slots.asyncUdpOpen: Submits an async request to open the socket in UDP mode and returns self immediately or an Error object on error.
slots.streamOpen: Opens the socket in stream mode. Returns self.
slots.writeTimeout: Returns the length of time in seconds for write timeouts on the socket.
slots.readTimeout: Returns the length of time in seconds for read timeouts on the socket.
slots.udpOpen: Opens the socket in UDP (connectionless) mode. Returns self.
slots.bytesPerWrite: Returns number of bytes to write per write call.
slots.setSocketReadLowWaterMark(numberOfBytes): Sets the read low water mark for the socket. Returns self on success or nil on error.
slots.streamWrite(buffer, optionalProgressBloc:
Writes buffer to the socket. 
	If optionalProgressBlock is supplied, it is periodically called with the number of bytes written as an argument.
	Returns self on success or an Error object on error.
slots.serverOpen:
Opens the socket as a stream, binds it to its address and calls asyncListen to prepare the socket to accept connections.
	Returns self on success or an Error object on error.
slots.connectTimeout: Returns the length of time in seconds for connect timeouts on the socket.
slots.asyncAccept(addressObject): Immediately returns a socket for a connection if one is available or nil otherwise. Returns an Error object on error.
slots.asyncUdpWrite(ipAddress, aSeq, startInde:
Writes readsize bytes from aSeq starting at startIndex to ipAddress. 
	Returns self immediately if successful. Returns an error object on Error. Returns nil if the socket is disconnected.

DNS.description: Utility methods related to Domain Name Service lookups.

slots.hostNameAndIPforDNSResponsePacket(dnsRes:
Dissasembles the given dnsResponsePacketSeq and returns a list object containing
the hostName and IP or an error string on error.
slots.dnsQueryPacketForHostName(hostNameSeq): Assembles a DNS query packet for the given host name and returns it in a Sequence.
slots.localNameServersIPs: Returns a list of local name server IPs as a list of Sequences. Works on OSX, Unix, Windows.

slots.macAddress: Returns the MAC address for the primary network adapter in a Hex string.

Blowfish.description:
The Blowfish object can be used to do encryption and decryption using the Blowfish keyed, symmetric block cipher.

Example encryption and decription; 

	
key := "secret"
data := "this is a message"

encryptedData := Blowfish clone setKey(key) encrypt(data)
decryptedData := Blowfish clone setKey(key) decrypt(encryptedData)
Or using the stream API: 
	
key := "secret"
data := "this is a message"

cipher = Blowfish clone
cipher setIsEncrypting(true)
cipher setKey(key)
cipher beginProcessing
cipher inputBuffer appendSeq(data)
cipher process
cipher endProcess
encryptedData := cipher outputBuffer

cipher = Blowfish clone
cipher setIsEncrypting(false)
cipher setKey(key)
cipher beginProcessing
cipher inputBuffer appendSeq(encryptedData)
cipher process
cipher endProcess
decryptedData := cipher outputBuffer

slots.decrypt(aSequence): Returns an decrypted version of aSequence.
slots.encrypt(aSequence): Returns an encrypted version of aSequence.
slots.setIsEncrypting(aBool): If aBool is true, encrypting mode is on, otherwise, decrypting mode is on.
slots.process:
Process the inputBuffer and appends the result to the outputBuffer.
	The processed inputBuffer is emptied except for the spare 
	bytes at the end which don't fit into a cipher block.
slots.beginProcessing: Sets the key from the key slot and initializes the cipher.
slots.endProcessing: Finish processing remaining bytes of inputBuffer.

ZlibDecoder.description:
For Zlib uncompression. Example use; 
	
z = ZlibDecoder clone
z beginProcessing
z inputBuffer appendSeq(inputData)
z process
z endProcess
result := z outputBuffer

slots.process:
Process the inputBuffer and appends the result to the outputBuffer.
	The processed inputBuffer is empties except for the spare bytes at the end which don't fit into a cipher block.
slots.endProcessing: Finish processing remaining bytes of inputBuffer.

ZlibEncoder.description:
For Zlib compression. Example use: 

	
z = ZlibEncoder clone
z beginProcessing
z inputBuffer appendSeq("this is a message")
z process
z endProcess
result := z outputBuffer

slots.process:
Process the inputBuffer and appends the result to the outputBuffer.
	The processed inputBuffer is empties except for the spare bytes at 
	the end which don't fit into a cipher block.
slots.endProcessing: Finish processing remaining bytes of inputBuffer.

Zlib.description:
The Zlib object can be used to compress and uncompress data using the zlib lossless data compression algorithm.

Example use; 

compressedData := Zlib compress(uncompressedData)
uncompressedData := Zlib uncompress(compressedData)

slots.uncompress(aSeq): Returns a uncompressed version of aSeq.
slots.compress(aSeq): Returns a compressed version of aSeq.

LZOEncoder.description:
The LZOEncoder object can be used to compress data using the Lempel-Ziv-Oberhumer (LZO) lossless data compression algorithm.

Example use; 

	
z = LZOEncoder clone
z beginProcessing
z inputBuffer appendSeq("this is a message")
z process
z endProcess
result := z outputBuffer

slots.process:
Process the inputBuffer and appends the result to the outputBuffer.
	The processed inputBuffer is emptied except for the spare bytes at 
	the end which don't fit into a cipher block.
slots.endProcessing: Finish processing remaining bytes of inputBuffer.

LZO.description:
The LZO object can be used to compress and uncompress data using the Lempel-Ziv-Oberhumer (LZO) lossless data compression algorithm.

Example use; 

compressedData := LZO compress(uncompressedData)
uncompressedData := LZO uncompress(compressedData)

slots.uncompress(aSeq): Returns a uncompressed version of aSeq.
slots.compress(aSeq): Returns a compressed version of aSeq.

LZODecoder.description:
The LZO object can be used to uncompress data using the Lempel-Ziv-Oberhumer (LZO) lossless data compression algorithm.

Example use; 

	
z = LZODecoder clone
z beginProcessing
z inputBuffer appendSeq("this is a message")
z process
z endProcess
result := z outputBuffer

slots.process:
Process the inputBuffer and appends the result to the outputBuffer.
	The processed inputBuffer is emptied except for the spare bytes at 
	the end which don't fit into a cipher block.
slots.endProcessing: Finish processing remaining bytes of inputBuffer.

slots.post: Posts the notification to the NotificationCenter.
slots.sender: Returns the sender of the notification.
slots.setSender(anObject): Sets the sender of the Notification. Returns self.
slots.setName(anObject): Sets the name of the Notification. Returns self.
slots.name: Returns the name of the notification.

slots.postNotification(aNotification):
Sends aNotification to be handled by listeners. Returns self. Implementation: 
listeners foreach(handleNotification(n))
slots.addListener(aNotificationListener): Removes aNotificationListener from listeners list. Returns self.

slots.setAction(messageName): Sets the name of the message that is sent to the target when a matching notification is found. Returns self.
slots.name: Returns the message name that the listener wants to receive messages for.
slots.setName(aSeq): Sets the message name that the listener wants to receive messages for. Returns self.
slots.action: Returns the name of the message that is sent to the target when a matching notification is found.
slots.setSender(anObject): Sets the sender that the listener wants to receive messages from. Returns self.
slots.setTarget(anObject): Sets the target that the receiver sends matching messages to. Returns self.
slots.start: Removes the receiver to the NotificationCenter set of listeners. Returns self.
slots.sender: Returns the sender that the listener wants to receive messages from.
slots.target: Returns the target that the receiver sends matching messages to.

Range.description: Simple datastructure representing the items at and between two specific points.

slots.previous:
Sets the current item in the range to the previous item in the range, 
	and returns a boolean value indicating whether it is not at the beginning of the range.
slots.last: Moves the current cursor to the end of the range, and returns it.
slots.toBy(endingPoint, incrementValue): Convenience constructor that returns a cursor object representing the range of numbers from the receiver to the 'endingPoint' parameter. Increments over each item in that range by the 'incrementValue' parameter.
slots.levenshtein(other): Returns the levenshtein distance to other.
slots.toBy(endpoint, increment): Convenience constructor that returns a range of sequences from the receiver to the endpoint argument. Increments over each item in that range by the value of the increment parameter. The increment parameter must be positive.
slots.first: Moves the current cursor to the beginning of the range, and returns it.
slots.rewind: Sets the current item and the index to the values the receiver started out with.
slots.map(optionalIndex, value, message):
Returns a new list which contains the result of the 'body' for every element stepped over in the range, from the starting point to the ending point inclusive. This method can operate several ways; these include: (1) Takes one argument, the message tree to be executed during each iteration; (2) Takes two arguments, the first argument is the name of the current value being iterated over, and the second is the message tree to be executed during each iteration; (3) Takes three arguments: the first is the current index within the range, the second is the name of the current value being iterated over, and the third is the message tree to be executed during each iteration. For example: 
# First method (operating on numbers)
1 to(10) map(*2) # multiply each value by two
# Second method (operating on numbers)
1 to(10) map(v, "#{v}" interpolate) # returns string representation of each value as list
# Third method (operating on numbers)
1 to(10) map(i, v, i*v) #  multiply each value by index
slots.indexOf(aValue): Calculates each value, checking to see if it matches the aValue parameter. If so, return the position within the range. NOTE: This method rewinds the range before searching. If you need to revert back to your original position, make a duplicate of the range, and use indexOf on it instead.
slots.at(position): Rewinds the range, skips forward until we're at the supplied position then returns the value at that position. Raises an exception if the position is out of bounds.
slots.to(endpoint): Convenience constructor that returns a range of sequences from the receiver to the endpoint argument. Increments over each item in that range by 1.
slots.foreach(optionalIndex, value, message):
Iterates over each item beginning with the starting point, and finishing at the ending point inclusive. This method can operate several ways; these include: (1) Takes one argument, the message tree to be executed during each iteration; (2) Takes two arguments, the first argument is the name of the current value being iterated over, and the second is the message tree to be executed during each iteration; (3) Takes three arguments: the first is the current index within the range, the second is the name of the current value being iterated over, and the third is the message tree to be executed during each iteration. For example: 
// First method (operating on numbers)
1 to(10) foreach("iterating" print) // prints "iterating" 10 times
// Second method (operating on numbers)
1 to(10) foreach(v, v print) // prints each value
// Third method (operating on numbers)
1 to(10) foreach(i, v, writeln(i .. ": " .. v)) // prints "index: value"
slots.asList: Returns a list containing all the items within and including the ranges starting and ending points.
slots.value: Returns the value of the current item in the range.
slots.index:
Returns the current index number starting from zero and extending 
outward up to the maximum number of items in the range.
slots.next:
Sets the current item in the range to the next item in the range, 
		and returns a boolean value indicating whether it is not at the end of the range.
slots.slice(start, end, [by]): Returns a list containing the values from the Range starting at the start parameter, ending at the end parameter, and optionally incremented by the by parameter.
slots.contains: Returns a boolean value if the range contains the argument.
slots.nextInSequence(skipVal): Returns the next item in the sequence.  The optional skipVal parameter allows you to skip ahead skipVal places.
slots.setRange(start, end, increment):
Has several modes of operation. First, if only two parameters are specified, 
	the increment value is set to 1 by default, while the first parameter represents
	the point to start from, and the second parameter represents the point to end at. 
	If the second parameter is smaller than the first, the range will operate backwards. 
	If the third parameter is specified, a custom iteration value will be used instead of 1.
slots.to: Convenience constructor that returns a cursor object representing the range of numbers from the receiver to the 'endingPoint' parameter. Increments over each item in that range by 1.

Message.description:
A Message object encapsulates the action of a message send. Blocks are composed of a Message and its children.

Terminology 

Example:
  Io> msg := message(A B(C D); E F)
  ==> A B(C D); E F
  
In the above example:
  msg name            =>  A
  msg next            =>  B(C D); E F
  msg next arguments  =>  list(C D)
  msg next next name  =>  ;
  msg next next next  =>  E F
Important: Modifying the message tree of a block currently in use may cause a crash if a garbage collection cycle occurs. If the implementation were changed to retain every called message, this could be avoided. But the cost to performance seems to outweigh the need to cover this case for now.

slots.previous: Returns the previous message in the message chain or Nil if there is no previous message.
slots.setLineNumber(aNumber): Sets the line number of the message. Returns self.
slots.appendCachedArg(aValue): Adds aValue to the argument list of receiver as a cachedResult.
slots.code: Returns a String containing a decompiled code representation of the receiver.
slots.asSimpleString: Returns one-line string representation up to 40 characters long.
slots.fluxSource: The directory of Flux where Flux.io is located. This directory is added to the Importer searchPaths.
slots.setPrevious(aMessageOrNil):
Sets the previous message in the message chain to a deep copy of
	aMessage or it removes the previous message if aMessage is Nil.
slots.lastBeforeEndOfLine: Returns the last message in the chain before the EndOfLine or nil.
slots.doInContext(anObject, locals):
Evaluates the receiver in the context of anObject. Optional <tt>locals</tt> 
	object is used as message sender. <tt>anObject</tt> is used as sender otherwise.
slots.fromString(aString):
Returns a new Message object for the compiled(but not executed)
	result of aString.
slots.characterNumber:
Returns the message character number. The character number is typically
	the beginning character index in the source text from which the message was read.
slots.argCount:
Returns the number of arguments this message has. A faster way to do, msg arguments size. Examples, 
	
Io> message(a(1,2,3)) argCount
==> 3

Io> message(a) argCount
==> 0
slots.clone: Returns a Message that is a deep copy of the receiver.
slots.lineNumber:
Returns the line number of the message. The character number
	is typically the line number in the source text from which the message was read.
slots.argAt(indexNumber): Returns Message object for the specified argument or Nil if none exists.
slots.asMessageWithEvaluatedArgs(optionalConte:
Returns a copy of receiver with arguments evaluated in the context of sender if
	optionalContext is nil.
slots.hasCachedResult: Returns true if there is a cached result. Nil is a valid cached result.
slots.label:
Returns the message label. The label is typically set to the
	name of the file from which the source code for the message was read.
slots.appendArg(aMessage):
Adds aMessage to the argument list of receiver. Examples: 
	
Io> message(a) appendArg(message(b))
==> a(b)

Io> message(a(1,2)) appendArg(message(3))
==> a(1, 2, 3)
slots.evaluatedArgs: Returns a List containing the argument messages evaluated in the context.
slots.cachedResult: Returns the cached result of the Message or Nil if there is none.
slots.arguments:
Returns a list of the message objects that act as the
	receiver's arguments. Modifying this list will not alter the actual
	list of arguments. Use the arguments_() method to do that.
slots.setCachedResult(anObject): Sets the cached result of the message. Returns self.
slots.removeCachedResult: Removes the cached result of the Message.
slots.last: Returns the last message in the chain.
slots.setCachedArgs(listOfValues): Appends evaluated arguments to a message. Returns self.
slots.setCharacterNumber(aNumber): Sets the character number of the message. Returns self.
slots.isEndOfLine: Returns true if the message marks the end of the line. A ';' message.
slots.codeOfLength(n): Same as <tt>Message code</tt>, but returns first <tt>n</tt> characters only.
slots.nextIgnoreEndOfLines:
Returns the next message in the message chain which is not an 
	EndOfLine or nil if there is no next message.
slots.name: Returns the name of the receiver.
slots.description: Returns a string containing a short description of the method.
slots.asStackEntry: Returns a string containing message name, file and line.
slots.setLabel(aString): Sets the label of the message and its children. Returns self.
slots.next: Returns the next message in the message chain or nil if there is no next message.
slots.setArguments(aListOfMessages):
Sets the arguments of the receiver to deep copies of
	those contained in aListOfMessages.  Returns self.
slots.setNext(aMessageOrNil):
Sets the next message in the message chain to a deep copy of
	aMessage or it removes the next message if aMessage is nil.
slots.union(other) Creates a union of the rece:
Returns a new message object with the receivers message as the first argument of the returned message, and the other parameter's arguments as each successive argument to the new message. 
  Io> message(a) union(message(b))
  ==> [unnamed](a, b)
slots.argsEvaluatedIn(anObject):
Returns a List containing the argument messages evaluated in the
	context of anObject.
slots.fluxPath: The directory where the .io files for the Flux views are located. This directory is added to the Importer searchPaths.
slots.setName(aString): Sets the name of the receiver. Returns self.

Coroutine.description: Coroutine is an primitive for Io's lightweight cooperative C-stack based threads.

slots.freeStack: Frees all the internal data from the receiver's stack. Returns self.
slots.stackSize: Stack size allocated for each new coroutine. Coroutines will automatically chain themselves as need if more stack space is required.
slots.result: The result set when the coroutine ends.
slots.runMessage: The message to send to the runTarget when the coroutine starts.
slots.setParentCoroutine(aCoro): Sets the parent coroutine. Returns self.
slots.ignoredCoroutineMethodNames: List of methods to ignore when building a <tt>callStack</tt>.
slots.setInException(aBool): Set the inException status. Returns self.
slots.callStack: Returns a list of Call objects.
slots.label: A label slot useful for debugging purposes.
slots.runLocals: The locals object in whose context the coroutine will send its run message.
slots.setLabel(aLabel): Sets the comment label for the Coro. Return self.
slots.raiseException: Sets exception in the receiver and resumes parent coroutine.
slots.setMessageDebugging(aBoolean):
Turns on message level debugging for this coro. When on, this
	coro will send a vmWillSendMessage message to the Debugger object before
	each message send and pause itself. See the Debugger object documentation
	for more information.
slots.pause:
Removes current coroutine from the yieldingCoros queue and yields to another coro. System exit is executed if no coros left.
You can resume a coroutine using either resume or resumeLater message.
slots.inException: Set to true when processing an exception in the coroutine.
slots.currentCoroutine: Returns currently running coroutine in Io state.
slots.resumeParentCoroutine: Pauses current coroutine and resumes parent.
slots.exception: Returns the current exception or nil if there is none.
slots.isCurrent: Returns true if the receiver is currently running coroutine.
slots.isYielding: Returns true if the receiver is yielding (not paused or running).
slots.main: [Seems to be obsolete!] Executes runMessage, resumes parent coroutine.
slots.resume:
Yields to the receiver. Runs the receiver if it is not running yet. 
	Returns self.
slots.setStackSize(aNumber): Sets the stack size in bytes to allocate for new Coros. Returns self.
slots.ioStack: Returns List of values on this coroutine's stack.
slots.resumeLater:
Promotes receiver to the top of the yieldingCoros queue, but not yielding to it.
		When current coroutine yields, receiver will resume.
slots.runTarget: The object which the coroutine will send a message to when it starts.
slots.yield:
Yields to another coroutine in the yieldingCoros queue.
		Does nothing if yieldingCoros is empty.
slots.showYielding: Prints a list of yielding coroutines to STDOUT.
slots.pauseCurrentAndResumeSelf: Pauses current coroutine and yields to a receiver.
slots.backTraceString: Returns a formatted callStack output along with exception info (if any). In case of CGI script, wraps output with <code> tag.
slots.parentCoroutine: Returns the parent coroutine this one was chained from or nil if it wasn't chained. When a Coroutine ends, it will attempt to resume its parent.

slots.yieldingCoros: The List of yielding Coroutine objects.
slots.setYieldingCoros(aListOfCoros): Sets the list of yielding Coroutine objects.
slots.setTimers(aListOfTimers): Sets the list of active timers.

Collector.description:
A singleton containing methods related to Io's garbage collector. Io currently uses a incremental, non-moving, generational collector based on the tri-color (black/gray/white) algorithm with a write-barrier.

Every N number of object allocs, the collector will walk some of the objects marked as gray, marking their connected white objects as gray and turning themselves black. Every M allocs, it will pause for a sweep where it makes sure all grays are marked black and io_frees all whites.

If the sweepsPerGeneration is set to zero, it will immediately mark all blacks as white again and mark the root objects as gray. Otherwise, it will wait until the sweepsPerGeneration count is reached to do this. By adjusting the allocsPerSweep and sweepsPerGeneration appropriately, the collector can be tuned efficiently for various usage cases. Generally, the more objects in your heap, the larger you'll want this number.

slots.setDebug(aBool): Turns on/off printing of collector debugging messages. Returns self.
slots.setMarksPerAlloc(aNumber):
Sets the number of incremental collector marks per object 
	allocation (can be fractional). Returns self.
slots.maxAllocatedBytes: Returns the maximum number of bytes allocated by the collector.
slots.cleanAllObjects: Sets all objects as clean. Returns self.
slots.collect: Runs garbage collector. Returns the number of items collected.
slots.dirtyObjects: Returns a List containing all dirty objects known to the collector.
slots.allocatedStep: Return the allocation step value as a Number.
slots.showStats: Prints the collector's stats to standard output.
slots.marksPerAlloc: Return the number of allocations per collector mark pass.
slots.allObjects: Returns a List containing all objects known to the collector.
slots.resetMaxAllocatedBytes: Resets maximum number of bytes allocated by the collector. Returns self.
slots.objectWithUniqueId(aNumber):
Returns an object whose uniqueId is aNumber or nil if no match is found. 
	Warning: This lookup currently scans all objects, so it is not efficient, 
	though it should handle thousands of lookups per second.
slots.timeUsed: Return the time used so far by the collector in seconds.
slots.setAllocatedStep(aNumber):
Sets the allocatedStep (can have a fractional component, 
	but must be larger than 1). A collector sweep is forced when the 
	number of allocated objects exceeds the allocatedSweepLevel. 
	After a sweep, the allocatedSweepLevel is set to the allocated 
	object count times the allocatedStep. Returns self.

Profiler.description: Basic support for profiling Io code execution.

slots.timedObjects: Returns a list of objects found in the system that have profile times.
slots.reset: Resets the profilerTime on all Block objects in the system.

File.credits: Initial version contributed by Miles Egan.
File.description:
Encapsulates file i/o. Here's an example of opening a file, and reversing its lines: 
	
file = File clone openForUpdating("/tmp/test")
lines = file readLines reverse
file rewind
lines foreach(i, line, file write(line, "\n"))
file close

slots.thisSourceFile: Returns a File representing the system file in which this Io code exists.
slots.readBufferOfLength(aNumber):
Reads a Buffer of the specified length and returns it.
	Returns Nil if the end of the file has been reached.
slots.readStringOfLength(aNumber):
Reads a String of the specified length and returns it.
	Returns Nil if the end of the file has been reached.
slots.standardInput: Returns a new File whose stream is set to the standard input stream.
slots.setPosition(aNumber): Sets the file position pointer to the byte specified by aNumber. Returns self.
slots.reopen(otherFile, mode):
Reopens otherFile and redirects its stream to this file's path using mode.
	If mode is omitted, it is copied from otherFile.
	Returns self or raises a File exception on error.
slots.moveTo(pathString):
Moves the file specified by the receiver's path to the
	new path pathString. Raises a File doesNotExist exception if the
	file does not exist or a File nameConflict exception if the file
	nameString already exists.
slots.parentDirectory: Returns a File for the directory that is the parent directory of this object's path.
slots.groupId: Returns a Number containing the group id associated with the file's path.
slots.userId: Returns a Number containing the user id associated with the file's path.
slots.lastAccessDate:
Returns a Date object containing the last date and
	time the file was accessed.
slots.readToBufferLength(aBuffer, aNumber):
Reads at most aNumber number of items and appends them to aBuffer.
	Returns number of items read.
slots.standardOutput: Returns a new File whose stream is set to the standard output stream.
slots.create: Creates an empty file at the file's path. Returns self on success, nil on failure.
slots.position: Returns the current file pointer byte position as a Number.
slots.readToEnd(chunkSize): Reads chunkSize bytes (4096 by default) at a time until end of file is reached.  Returns a sequence containing the bytes read from the file.
slots.open(optionalPathString):
Opens the file. Creates one if it does not exist.
	If the optionalPathString argument is provided, the path is set to it before
	opening. Returns self or raises an File exception on error.
slots.rewind: Sets the file position pointer to the beginning of the file.
slots.readLines: Returns list containing all lines in the file.
slots.popen:
Open the file as a pipe. Return self.

	Closing a popen'ed file sets exitStatus or termSignal
	to reflect the status or cause of the child processes' termination.
slots.isAtEnd: Returns true if the file is at its end. Otherwise returns false.
slots.streamReadSize: Size of stream buffer used for streaming operations
slots.openForAppending(optionalPathString):
Sets the file mode to append (writing to the end of the file)
	and calls open(optionalPathString).
slots.termSignal: Pipe's terminating signal (after file close opened via popen).
slots.isSocket: Returns true if the receiver's file descriptor is a Socket, false otherwise.
slots.isOpen: Returns self if the file is open. Otherwise returns Nil.
slots.readLine:
Reads the next line of the file and returns it as a
	string without the return character. Returns Nil if the 
	end of the file has been reached.
slots.temporaryFile:
Returns a new File object with an open temporary file. The file is
	automatically deleted when the returned File object is closed or garbage collected.
slots.with(aPath): Returns a new instance with the provided path.
slots.isRegularFile: Returns true if the receiver's file descriptor is a regular file, false otherwise.
slots.descriptor: Returns the file's descriptor as a number.
slots.truncateToSize(numberOfBytes): Truncates the file's size to the numberOfBytes. Returns self.
slots.isDirectory: Returns true if the receiver's path points to a directory, false otherwise.
slots.setStreamDestination(aBuffer): Set the buffer to be used for future stream operations.
slots.streamDestination: The buffer object to be used for future stream operations.
slots.openForUpdating(optionalPathString):
Sets the file mode to update (reading and writing) and calls
	open(optionalPathString). This will not delete the file if it already exists.
	Use the remove method first if you need to delete an existing file before opening a new one.
slots.mode: Returns the open mode of the file(either read, update or append).
slots.copyToPathWithoutYielding(destinationPat: Copies the file to the specified path without yielding.
slots.close:
Closes the receiver if open, otherwise does nothing. Returns self.

	When the file was opened via popen, sets either exitStatus or
	termSignal to the exit status on normal exit, or the signal causing
	abnormal termination.
slots.foreachLine(optionalLineNumber, line, me:
For each line, set index to the line number of the line and line and execute aMessage. Example usage: 
	
aFile foreachLine(i, v, writeln("Line ", i, ": ", v))
aFile foreach(v, writeln("Line: ", v))
slots.stat: Updates the receiver's meta info cache.
slots.lastInfoChangeDate:
Returns a Date object containing the last date and
	time the file's meta info was changed.
slots.write(aSequence1, aSequence2, ...): Writes the arguments to the receiver file. Returns self.
slots.standardError: Returns a new File whose stream is set to the standard error stream.
slots.atPut(positionNumber, byteNumber):
Writes the byte value of byteNumber to the file position
	positionNumber. Returns self.
slots.path: Returns the file path of the receiver.
slots.positionAtEnd: Sets the file position pointer to the end of the file.
slots.setContents(aSeq): Replaces the contents for the file with aSeq. Returns self.
slots.contents: Returns contents of the file as a mutable Sequence of bytes.
slots.name: Returns the last path component of the file path.
slots.lastDataChangeDate:
Returns a Date object containing the last date and
	time the file's contents were changed.
slots.baseName: Returns File's name without an extension (returned Sequence consists of all characters up to final period ["."] character).
slots.streamTo(aBuffer): Perform streamed reading to given buffer. The buffer will be appended with chunks of size streamReadSize until EOF. The final chunk may be less than streamReadSize.
slots.size: Returns the file size in bytes.
slots.isPipe: Returns true if the receiver is a pipe, false otherwise.
slots.protectionMode:
Returns a Number containing the protection mode
	associated with the file's path.
slots.openForReading(optionalPathString): Sets the file mode to read (reading only) and calls open(optionalPathString).
slots.remove:
Removes the file specified by the receiver's path.
	Raises an error if the file exists but is not removed. Returns self.
slots.statSize: Returns the file's size in bytes as a Number.
slots.streamToWithoutYielding(aBuffer): Perform streamed reading to given buffer without yielding between reads.
slots.at(aNumber):
Returns a Number containing the byte at the specified
	byte index or Nil if the index is out of bounds.
slots.setPath(aString):
Sets the file path of the receiver to pathString.
	The default path is an empty string. Returns self.
slots.isUserExecutable: Returns true if the receiver is user group executable, false otherwise.
slots.flush: Forces any buffered data to be written to disk. Returns self.
slots.copyToPath(destinationPath): Copies the file to the specified path.
slots.exists(optionalPath):
Returns true if the file path exists, and false otherwise.
	If optionalPath string is provided, it tests the existance of that path instead.
slots.appendToContents(aSeq): Appends to the contents of the file with aSeq. Returns self.
slots.foreach(optionalIndex, value, message):
For each byte, set index to the index of the byte and value to the number containing the byte value and execute aMessage. Example usage: 

	
aFile foreach(i, v, writeln("byte at ", i, " is ", v))
aFile foreach(v, writeln("byte ", v))
slots.asBuffer:
Opens the receiver in read only mode, reads the whole
	contents of the file into a buffer object, closes the file and returns the buffer.
slots.startStreaming: Begin streamed read to stream destination set by setStreamDestination(aBuffer).
slots.isLink: Returns true if the receiver's path points to a link, false otherwise.

CFunction.description:
A container for a pointer to a C function binding. 
CFunction's can only be defined from the C side and act 
like blocks in that when placed in a slot, are called when the 
slot is activated. The for, if, while and clone methods of the Lobby 
are examples of CFunctions. CFunctions are useful for implementing 
methods that require the speed of C or binding to a C library.

slots.typeName: Returns the owning type of the CFunction or nil if the CFunction can be called on any object.
slots.performOn(target, blockLocals, optionalM: Activates the CFunctions with the supplied settings.
slots.id: Returns a number containing a unique id for the receiver's internal C function.
slots.==(anObject): Returns self if the argument is a CFunction with the same internal C function pointer.
slots.name: Returns the CFunction name in the form CFunction_Pointer.
slots.uniqueName: Returns the name given to the CFunction.

Number.description: A container for a double (a 64bit floating point number on most platforms).

slots.isControlCharacter:
Returns true if 
	receiver is a control character value
	, false otherwise.
slots.constants: Object containing number constants e, inf, nan and pi.
slots.justSerialized(stream): Writes the receiver's code into the stream.
slots.ceil:
Returns the a number with the receiver's value rounded up to
	the nearest integer if its fractional component is greater than 0.
slots.log10: Returns the base 10 logarithm of the receiver.
slots.^(aNumber): Returns the bitwise xor with the receiver (both numbers are converted to longs for the operation).
slots.&(aNumber): Returns a new number with the bitwise AND of the receiver and aNumber.
slots.asUint32Buffer: Returns a Sequence containing a 4 byte representation of the uint32 value of the receiver.
slots.cos: Returns the cosine of the receiver.
slots.abs: Returns a number with the absolute value of the receiver.
slots.isNan: Returns true if the receiver is not a number. Otherwise returns false.
slots.isGraph:
Returns true if 
	the receiver is a printing character value except space
	, false otherwise.
slots.sin: Returns the sine of the receiver.
slots.asUppercase: Returns a new Number containing a upper case version of the receiver.
slots.isEven:
Returns true if 
	integer form of the receiver is even
	, false otherwise.
slots.toggle: Returns 1 if the receiver is 0. Returns 0 otherwise.
slots.atan: Returns a number with the arc tangent of the receiver.
slots.isPunctuation:
Returns true if 
	the receiver is a punctuation character value
	, false otherwise.
slots.isPrint:
Returns true if 
	the receiver is a printing character value, including space
	, false otherwise.
slots.bitwiseAnd(aNumber): Returns a new number with the bitwise AND of the receiver and aNumber.
slots.*(aNumber): Returns a new number that is the product of the receiver and aNumber.
slots.permutations(size): Returns the permutations where the receiver is the number of different objects and size is the number to be arranged.
slots.isSpace:
Returns true if 
	the receiver is a space, formfeed, newline carriage return, tab or vertical tab character value
	, false otherwise.
slots.isHexDigit:
Returns true if 
	the receiver is a hexadecimal character value
	, false otherwise.
slots.min(aNumber): Returns the lesser of the receiver and aNumber.
slots.toBase(base): Returns the number in another base. 42 toBase(2) -> "101010"
slots.-(aNumber): Returns a new number that is the difference of the receiver and aNumber.
slots.between(aNumber1, aNumber2):
Returns true if the receiver's value is between or
	equal to aNumber1 and aNumber2, otherwise returns false.
slots.round:
Returns a number with the receiver's value rounded up to
	the nearest integer if its fraction component is >= .5 or rounded up to the nearest integer otherwise.
slots.negate: Returns new number that is negated version of the receiver.
slots.|(aNumber): Returns a new number with the bitwise OR of the receiver and aNumber.
slots.asLowercase: Returns a new Number containing a lower case version of the receiver.
slots.clip(aNumber1, aNumber2):
Returns self if the receiver is between aNumber1 and aNumber2.
	Returns aNumber1 if it is less than aNumber1. Returns aNumber2 if it is greater than aNumber2.
slots.<<(aNumber): Shifts the bits of the receiver left by the number of places specified by aNumber.
slots.doubleMin: Returns the minimum double precision float value.
slots.atan2(aNumber): Returns a number with the arc tangent of y/x where y is the receiver and x is aNumber.
slots.floor:
Returns a number with the receiver's value rounded
	down to the nearest integer if its fractional component is not 0.
slots.floatMax: Returns the maximum double precision float value.
slots.asHex: Returns the number as hex digits inside a string. 97 asHex -> "61"
slots.asString(optionalIntegerDigits, optional:
Returns a string representation of the receiver. For example: 
1234.5678 asString(0, 2)
would return: 
1234.57
slots.pow(aNumber): Returns the value of the receiver to the aNumber power.
slots.factorial: Returns the factorial of the receiver.
slots.asOctal: Returns the number as octal digits inside a string. 436 asOctal -> "664"
slots.squared: Returns the square of the receiver.
slots.asCharacter:
Returns a String containing a single character whose
	value is the value of the first byte of the receiver.
	Returns nil if the number has no valid UCS mapping.
slots.repeat(optionalIndex, expression):
Evaluates message a number of times that corresponds to the receivers
	integer value. This is significantly faster than a for() or while() loop.
slots.unsignedIntMax: Returns the maximum unsigned int value.
slots.tan: Returns the tangent of the receiver.
slots.isUppercase:
Returns true if 
	the receiver is a uppercase character value
	, false otherwise.
slots.cubed: Returns the cube of the receiver.
slots.log:
Returns the logarithm of the receiver.  The base
	is taken as the value of the first argument or the constant e if
	the first argument is omitted.
slots.combinations(size): Returns the combinations where the receiver is the number of different objects and size is the number to be arranged.
slots.toBaseWholeBytes(base): Returns the number in another base printing out entire bytes. 42 toBaseWholeBytes(2) -> "00101010"
slots.isInASequenceSet: Return true if receiver is in one of the Sequence sequenceSets, otherwise false.
slots.isDigit:
Returns true if 
	receiver is a numeric digit value
	, false otherwise.
slots.isOdd:
Returns true if 
	integer form of the receiver is odd
	, false otherwise.
slots.acos: Returns a number with the arc cosine of the receiver.
slots.asBuffer(optionalNumberOfBytes):
Returns a Buffer containing a the number of bytes specified by
	optionalNumberOfBytes (up to the size of a double on the platform) of the receiver.
	If no optionalNumberOfBytes is specified, it is assumed to be the number of bytes
	in a double on the host platform.
slots.roundDown:
Returns a number with the receiver's value rounded down to
	the nearest integer if its fraction component is <= .5 or rounded up the the nearest integer otherwise.
slots.+(aNumber): Returns a new number that is the sum of the receiver and aNumber.
slots.bitwiseXor(aNumber): Returns a new number with the bitwise XOR of the receiver and aNumber.
slots.log2: Returns the base 2 logarithm of the receiver.
slots.at(bitIndexNumber):
Returns a new Number containing 1 if the receiver cast to a long
	has its bit set to 1 at bitIndexNumber. Otherwise returns 0.
slots.bitwiseComplement:
Returns a new number with the bitwise complement of the
	receiver. (The 0 bits become 1s and the 1 bits become 0s. )
slots.isLowercase:
Returns true if 
	the receiver is a lowercase character value
	, false otherwise.
slots.bitwiseOr(aNumber): Returns a new number with the bitwise AND of the receiver and aNumber.
slots.unsignedShortMax: Returns the minimum unsigned int value.
slots.exp: Returns e to the power of the receiver.
slots.isLetter:
Returns true if 
	receiver is a letter character value
	, false otherwise.
slots.isAlphaNumeric:
Returns true if 
	receiver is an alphanumeric character value
	, false otherwise.
slots.sqrt: Returns the square root of the receiver.
slots.>>(aNumber): Shifts the bits of the receiver right by the number of places specified by aNumber.
slots.minMax(low, high): Returns a number between or equal to low and high. If the receiver is equal to or between low and high, the receiver is returned. If the receiver is less than low, low is returned. If the receiver is greater than high, high is returned.
slots.max(aNumber): Returns the greater of the receiver and aNumber.
slots.asin: Returns a number with the arc sine of the receiver.
slots.\/(aNumber): Returns a new number with the value of the receiver divided by aNumber.
slots.asBinary: Returns the number as binary digits inside a string. 42 asBinary -> "101010"
slots.unsignedLongMax: Returns the maximum unsigned long value.

Exception.description:
The Exception proto is used for raising exceptions and instances are used to hold rexception related info.

Raise

An exception can be raised by calling raise() on an exception proto. Exception raise("generic foo exception")

Try and Catch

To catch an exception, the try() method of the Object proto is used. try() will catch any exceptions that occur within it and return the caught exception or nil if no exception is caught. 

e := try()
To catch a particular exception, the Exception catch() method can be used. Example: 
e := try(
    // ...
)

e catch(Exception,
    writeln(e coroutine backtraceString)
)
The first argument to catch indicates which types of exceptions will be caught. catch() returns the exception if it doesn't match and nil if it does.

Pass

To re-raise an exception caught by try(), use the pass method. This is useful to pass the exception up to the next outer exception handler, usually after all catches failed to match the type of the current exception: 

e := try(
    // ...
)

e catch(Error,
    // ...
) catch(Exception,
    // ...
) pass

Custom Exceptions

Custom exception types can be implemented by simply cloning an existing Exception type: 

MyErrorType := Error clone

slots.originalCall: Returns the call object associated with the exception.
slots.caughtMessage: Returns the message object associated with the exception.
slots.error: Returns the coroutine that the exception occurred in.
slots.showStack: Print the exception and related stack.
slots.pass: Pass the exception up the stack.
slots.raise(error, optionalNestedException): Raise an exception with the specified error message.
slots.catch(exceptionProto): Catch an exception with the specified exception prototype.
slots.nestedException: Returns the nestedException if there is one.

Object.description:
An Object is a key/value dictionary with string keys and values of any type.
The prototype Object contains a clone slot that is a CFunction that creates new objects.
When cloned, an Object will call its init slot (with no arguments).

slots.forward:
Called when the receiver is sent a message it doesn't recognize. Default implementation raises an "Object doesNotRespond" exception. Subclasses can override this method to implement proxies or special error handling.

Example: 

myProxy forward = method(
	messageName := thisMessage name
	arguments := thisMessage arguments
	myObject doMessage(thisMessage)
)
slots.pause:
Removes current coroutine from the yieldingCoros queue and yields to another coro. Exits if no coros left.
See Coroutine documentation for more details.
slots.actorProcessQueue: Processes each message in a queue, yielding between each message.
slots.continue:
Skip the rest of the current loop iteration and start on
	the next, if any.
slots.coroDo(code):
Creates a new coro to be run in a context of sender and yields to it.
		Returns a coro.
slots.setProtos(aList): Replaces the receiver's protos with a copy of aList. Returns self.
slots.>=(expression):
Evaluates argument and returns self if self is greater
	than or equal to it, or Nil if not.
slots.(expression): The '' method evaluates the argument and returns the result.
slots.addTrait: Takes another object, whose slots will be copied into the receiver. Optionally takes a second argument, a Map object containing string -> string pairs, holding conflicting slot names and names to rename them to. I.e., if you have two objects A and B, both have a slot named foo, you issue A addTrait(B, Map clone atPut("foo", "newFoo")) the value of B foo will be placed in A newFoo.
slots.persist: Force immediate persistence of this object with PDB.
slots.write(<any number of arguments>): Sends a print message to the evaluated result of each argument. Returns Nil.
slots.memorySize: Return the amount of memory used by the object.
slots.updateSlot(slotNameString, valueObject):
Same as setSlot(), but raises an error if the slot does not
	already exist in the receiver's slot lookup path.
slots.inlineMethod:
Creates a method which is executed directly in a receiver (no Locals object is created). 
  Io> m := inlineMethod(x := x*2)
  Io> x := 1
  ==> 1
  Io> m
  ==> 2
  Io> m
  ==> 4
  Io> m
  ==> 8
slots.coroWith(code): Returns a new coro to be run in a context of receiver.
slots.evalArgAndReturnSelf(expression): Evaluates the argument and returns the target.
slots.compare(anObject): Returns a number containing the comparison value of the target with anObject.
slots.>(expression): Evaluates argument and returns self if self is greater than it, or Nil if not.
slots.relativeDoFile(pathString):
Evaluates the File in the context of the receiver. Returns the result. 
		pathString is relative to the file calling doRelativeFile. (Duplicate of doRelativeFile)
slots.ifDebug(code): Executes code if debugWriteln is not nil.
slots.returnIfNonNil:
Returns the receiver from the current execution block if it is non nil.
	Otherwise returns the receiver locally.
slots.slotValues: Returns a list of the values held in the slots of the receiver.
slots.doRelativeFile(pathString):
Evaluates the File in the context of the receiver. Returns the result. 
		pathString is relative to the file calling doRelativeFile. (Duplicate of relativeDoFile)
slots.debugOff: Sets debugWriteln to nil. Returns self.
slots.shallowCopy: Returns a shallow copy of the receiver.
slots.and(arg): Evaluates argument and returns the result.
slots.launchFile(pathString): Eval file at pathString as if from the command line in its folder.
slots.super(aMessage):
Sends the message aMessage to the receiver's proto with the context of self. Example: 
	self test(1, 2)   // performs test(1, 2) on self
	super(test(1, 2)) // performs test(1, 2) on self proto but with the context of self
slots.print: Prints a string representation of the object. Returns Nil.
slots.contextWithSlot(slotName):
Returns the first context (starting with the receiver and following the lookup path)
	that contains a slot of the specified name or Nil if none is found.
slots...(arg): .. is an alias for: method(arg, self asString append(arg asString))
slots.-(aNumber):
Returns the negative version of aNumber.
	Raises an exception if argument is not a number.
slots.clone: Returns a clone of the receiver.
slots.removeAllProtos: Removes all of the receiver's protos. Returns self.
slots.persistMetaData: Force immediate persistence of this object's type data into PDB
slots.try(code):
Executes particular code in a new coroutine. Returns exception or nil if no exception is caught.
See also documentation for Exception catch and pass.
slots.coroDoLater(code):
Returns a new coro to be run in a context of sender. New coro is moved to the top of the yieldingCoros queue to be executed when current coro yields.
Note: run target is self (i.e. receiver), not call sender as in coroDo.
slots.doString(aString): Evaluates the string in the context of the receiver. Returns the result.
slots.handleActorException(exception):
Callback for handling exceptions during asynchronous message processing.
Default value: method(e, e showStack)
slots.protos: Returns a copy of the receiver's protos list.
slots.getLocalSlot(slotNameString):
Returns the value of the slot named slotNameString
	(not looking in the object's protos) or nil if no such slot is found.
slots.persistSlots: Force immediate persistence of this object's dirty slots into PDB.
slots.foreachSlot(slotName, slotValue, code):
Iterates over all the slots in a receiver. Provides slotValue (non-activated) along with slotName. Code is executed in context of sender. slotName and slotValue become visible in the receiver (no Locals created! Maybe, it is not the best decision). 
  Io> thisContext foreachSlot(n, v, n println)
  Lobby
  Protos
  exit
  forward
  n
  v
  ==> false
slots.block(args..., body):
Creates a block and binds it to the sender context (i.e. lexical context). In other words, block locals' proto is sender's locals. args is a list of formal arguments (can be empty).
body is evaluated in the context of Locals object.
See also Object method. 
	Io> block(x, x*2) scope == thisContext
  ==> true
slots.coroFor(code): Returns a new coro to be run in a context of sender.
slots.<=(expression):
Evaluates argument and returns self if self is less
	than or equal to it, or Nil if not.
slots.==(aValue): Returns true if receiver and aValue are equal, false otherwise.
slots.?(aMessage):
description: Sends the message aMessage to the receiver if it can respond to it. Example: 
	MyObject test // performs test
	MyObject ?test // performs test if MyObject has a slot named test
The search for the slot only follows the receivers proto chain.
slots.do(expression): Evaluates the message in the context of the receiver. Returns self.
slots.method(args..., body):
Creates a method. args is a list of formal arguments (can be empty).
body is evaluated in the context of Locals object.
Locals' proto is a message receiver (i.e. self).
Slot with a method is activatable. Use getSlot(name) to retrieve method object without activating it (i.e. calling).
See also Object block.
slots.lexicalDo(expression):
Evaluates the message in the context of the receiver.
	The lexical context is added as a proto of the receiver while the argument is evaluated.
	Returns self.
slots.debugWriteln: Method for writing debug messages (nil/writeln by default)
slots.setIsActivatable(aValue):
When called with a non-Nil aValue, sets the object
	to call its activate slot when accessed as a value. Turns this behavior
	off if aValue is Nil. Only works on Objects which are not Activatable
	Primitives (such as CFunction or Block). Returns self.
slots.@@:
Same as Object @, but returns nil instead of FutureProxy.
Might be useful in a command line or as a last expression in a block/method when you don't want to return a future.
slots.getSlot(slotNameString):
Returns the value of the slot named slotNameString
	(following the lookup path) or nil if no such slot is found.
slots.!=(aValue): Returns true the receiver is not equal to aValue, false otherwise.
slots.thisMessage: Returns the calling message (i.e. thisMessage itself, huh).
slots.hasProto(anObject): Returns true if anObject is found in the proto path of the target, false otherwise.
slots.<(expression): Evaluates argument and returns self if self is less or Nil if not.
slots.println: Same as print, but also prints a new line. Returns self.
slots.setSlot(slotNameString, valueObject):
Sets the slot slotNameString in the receiver to
	hold valueObject. Returns valueObject.
slots.evalArg(expression): The '' method evaluates the argument and returns the result.
slots.memorySizeOfState:
Returns the number of bytes in the IoState
	(this may not include memory allocated by C libraries).
slots.prependProto(anObject): Prepends anObject to the receiver's proto list. Returns self.
slots.message(expression):
Return the message object for the argument or Nil if there is no argument.
	Note: returned object is a mutable singleton. Use "message(foo) clone" if
  you wish to modify it.
slots.type: Returns a string containing the name of the type of Object (Number, String, etc).
slots.argIsActivationRecord: Note: seems to be an obsolete method.
slots.perform(methodName, <arg1>, <arg2>, ...): Performs the method corresponding to methodName with the arguments supplied.
slots.yield:
Yields to another coroutine. Does nothing if yieldingCoros queue is empty.
See Coroutine documentation for more details.
slots.doURL(urlString): Fetches the URL and evals it in the context of the receiver.
slots.justSerialized(stream):
Writes serialized representation to a SerializationStream. Returns stream contents. 
  [This is unintended side effect! Returned value may change in the future.]
slots.slotDescriptionMap:
Returns raw map of slot names and short values' descriptions.
  See also <tt>Object slotSummary</tt>.
slots.isIdenticalTo(aValue): Returns true if the receiver is identical to aValue, false otherwise.
slots.NullCharacter: A sequence with a single zero byte.
slots.appendProto(anObject): Appends anObject to the receiver's proto list. Returns self.
slots.ancestors: Returns a list of all of the receiver's ancestors as found by recursively following the protos links.
slots.hasSlot(name):
Returns <tt>true</tt> if slot is found somewhere in the inheritance chain 
  (including receiver itself).
slots.serialized:
Returns a serialized representation of the receiver. 
  Io> Object clone do(x:=1) serialized
  ==> Object clone do(
  	x := 1
  )
slots.performWithArgList(methodName, argList): Performs the method corresponding to methodName with the arguments in the argList.
slots.localsForward: CFunction used by Locals prototype for forwarding.
slots.checkMemory():
Accesses memory in the IoObjectData struct that should be accessible.  Should cause a memory access
	exception if memory is corrupt.
slots.ifNonNilEval(arg): Evaluates argument and returns the result.
slots.if(<condition>, <trueMessage>, <optional:
Evaluates trueMessage if condition evaluates to a non-Nil.
	Otherwise evaluates optionalFalseMessage if it is present.
	Returns the result of the evaluated message or Nil if none was evaluated.
slots.break(optionalReturnValue): Break the current loop, if any.
slots.setPpid: PDB extension to set the value returned by ppid.
slots.pSlots:
PDB extension to set a list of slots to persist with PDB.
Creates the specified slots using newSlot and sets them to nil.
slots.become(anotherObject):
Replaces receiver with anotherObject and returns self. Useful for implementing transparent proxies. See also FutureProxy and Object @.
Note: primitives cannot become new values.
slots.persistData:
Force immediate persistence of this object's serialized form (using asSerialization)
into PDB, if possible.
slots.isKindOf(anObject): Returns true if anObject is in the receiver's ancestors.
slots.serializedSlots(stream): Writes all slots to a stream.
slots.removeSlot(slotNameString): Removes the specified slot (only) in the receiver if it exists. Returns self.
slots.setProto(anObject):
Sets the first proto of the receiver to anObject, replacing the
	current one, if any. Returns self.
slots.compact: Compact the memory for the object if possible. Returns self.
slots.foreach([name,] value, message):
For each slot, set name to the slot's name and value to the slot's value and execute message. Examples: 

myObject foreach(n, v,
	writeln("slot ", n, " = ", v type)
)

myObject foreach(v,
	writeln("slot type ", v type)
)
slots.deprecatedWarning(optionalNewName):
Prints a warning message that the current method is deprecated.
	If optionalNewName is supplied, the warning will suggest using that instead.
	Returns self.
slots.removeProto(anObject):
Removes anObject from the receiver's proto list if it
	is present. Returns self.
slots.uniqueId: Returns a Number containing a unique id for the receiver.
slots.unpersist: PDB extension to populate this object with the data associated with this object's ppid from PDB.
slots.setSlotWithType(slotNameString, valueObj:
Sets the slot slotNameString in the receiver to
	hold valueObject and sets the type slot of valueObject
	to be slotNameString. Returns valueObject.
slots.hasLocalSlot(slotNameString): Returns true if the slot exists in the receiver or false otherwise.
slots.serializedSlotsWithNames(names, stream): Writes selected slots to a stream.
slots.isActivatable: Returns true if the receiver is activatable, false otherwise.
slots.wait(s):
Pauses current coroutine for at least s seconds.
Note: current coroutine may wait much longer than designated number of seconds depending on circumstances.
slots.list(...): Returns a List containing the arguments.
slots.slotNames:
Returns a list of strings containing the names of the
	slots in the receiver (but not in its lookup path).
slots.isLaunchScript: Returns true if the current file was run on the command line. Io's version of Python's __file__ == "__main__"
slots.shouldPersistByDefault:
PDB boolean flag indicating whether this object should be considered for persistence
when persistence has not been specifically requested by calling ppid() or PDB addObjectToPersist.
Always false by default for Object.
slots.doFile(pathString):
Evaluates the File in the context of the receiver. Returns the result.
	pathString is relative to the current working directory.
slots.@:
Sends asynchronous message to an object, returns a FutureProxy.
Caller coroutine is paused when proxy is accessed (i.e. message is sent) till result is ready. Proxy will become an actual result when it is ready.
See IoGuide for more information.
Usage: obj @someMethod(a, b, c)
slots.for(<counter>, <start>, <end>, <do messa: A for-loop control structure. See the io Programming Guide for a full description.
slots.ancestorWithSlot(slotName):
Returns the first ancestor of the receiver that contains
	a slot of the specified name or Nil if none is found.
slots.uniqueHexId:
Returns uniqueId in a hexadecimal form (with a "0x" prefix) 
  Io> Object uniqueId
  ==> 3146784
  Io> Object uniqueHexId
  ==> 0x300420
slots.actorRun: Starts actor mode if not started already. Basically, sets actorProcessQueue for later execution.
slots.debugOn: Sets debugWriteln to writeln. Returns self.
slots.argIsCall(arg):
Returns true if arg is an activation context (i.e. Call object)
Note: this is used internally in one place only (Coroutine callStack). Refactoring should be considered.
slots.writeln(<any number of arguments>): Same as write() but also writes a return character at the end. Returns Nil.
slots.removeAllSlots: Removes all of the receiver's slots. Returns self.
slots.slotSummary:
Returns a formatted slotDescriptionMap. 
  Io> slotSummary
  ==>  Object_0x30c590:
    Lobby            = Object_0x30c590
    Protos           = Object_0x30c880
    exit             = method(...)
    forward          = method(...)
slots.newSlot(slotName, aValue):
Creates a getter and setter for the slot with the name slotName
	and sets its default value to aValue. Returns self. For example,
	newSlot("foo", 1) would create slot named foo with the value 1 as well as a setter method setFoo().
slots.loop(expression): Keeps evaluating message until a break.
slots.cloneWithoutInit: Returns a clone of the receiver but does not call init.
slots.doMessage(aMessage, optionalContext):
Evaluates the message object in the context of the receiver.
	Returns the result. optionalContext can be used to specific the locals
	context in which the message is evaluated.
slots.lazySlot(code):
Defines a slot with a lazy initialization code. Code is run only once: the first time slot is accessed. Returned value is stored in a regular slot. 
  Io> x := lazySlot("Evaluated!" println; 17)
  Io> x
  Evaluated!
  ==> 17
  Io> x
  ==> 17
  Io> x
  ==> 17

Another form is lazySlot(name, code): 
  Io> lazySlot("x", "Evaluated!" println; 17)
  Io> x
  Evaluated!
  ==> 17
  Io> x
  ==> 17
  Io> x
  ==> 17
slots.isError: Returns false if not an error.
slots.resend:
