Send the message used to activate the current method to the Object's proto. For example: 
  Dog := Mammal clone do(
    init := method(
  	  resend
    )
  )
Calling Dog init will send an init method to Mammal, but using the Dog's context.
slots.ppid:
This PDB extension returns a unique identifier for this object and registers it
for persistence with PDB.
slots.while(<condition>, expression):
Keeps evaluating message until condition return Nil.
	Returns the result of the last message evaluated or Nil if none were evaluated.
slots.evalArgAndReturnNil(expression): Evaluates the argument and returns nil.
slots.switch(<key1>, <expression1>, <key2>, <e: Execute an expression depending on the value of the caller. (This is an equivalent to C switch/case) hour := Date hour switch( 12, "midday", 0, "midnight", 17, "teatime", Date hour asString )
slots.compactState: Attempt to compact the memory of the IoState if possible.
slots.return(anObject): Return anObject from the current execution block.

Sandbox.description: Sandbox can be used to run separate instances of Io within the same process.

slots.messageCount: Returns a number containing the messageCount limit of the Sandbox.
slots.timeLimit: Returns a number containing the time limit of calls made to the Sandbox.
slots.setTimeLimit(aDouble): Sets the time limit of the Sandbox.
slots.printCallback(string): default implementation is; method(string, string print)
slots.setMessageCount(anInteger): Sets the messageCount limit of the receiver.

Directory.credits: Cygwin code by Mike Austin. WIN32 code by Daniel Vollmer.

slots.walk:
Recursively walks the current directory, and executes a given callback on each item (either File or Directory) found, excluding "." and "..". 
Io> Directory walk(println)
A0_List.io
A1_OperatorTable.io
...
Io> Directory walk(f, if(f name startsWithSeq("Directory"), f println))
Directory.io
slots.filesWithExtension(aString):
Returns a list of File objects for the files in the Directory (no directories)
    with the specified file extension.
slots.currentWorkingDirectory: Returns the current working directory path.
slots.directoryNamed(aName): Returns a Directory object for the specified file name whether or not it exists.
slots.files: Returns a list of File objects for the files in the Directory (no directories).
slots.recursiveFilesOfTypes(suffixes):
Returns a list containing all files in the directory or any subdirectory that
    has any of the specified suffixes.
slots.with(aPath): Returns a new instance with the provided path.
slots.path: Returns the directory path. The default path is '.'.
slots.create:
Create the directory if it doesn't exist. 
	Returns self on success (or if the directory already exists), nil on failure.
slots.ancestorDirectories: Returns a list of ancestor directories.
slots.fileNamed(aName): Returns a File object for the specified file name whether it exists or not.
slots.createSubdirectory(name): Create a subdirectory with the specified name.
slots.size:
Returns a Number containing the number of file and directory
	objects at the receiver's path.
slots.items:
Returns a list object containing File and Directory objects
	for the files and directories of the receiver's path.
slots.createFileNamed(name): Deprecated. Returns a new file object in the directory with the specified name.
slots.parentDirectory: Returns the parent directory object or nil if there is no parent directory.
slots.setCurrentWorkingDirectory(pathString):
Sets the current working directory path.
	Returns true on success or false on error.
slots.setPath(aString): Sets the directory path. Returns self.
slots.name: Returns the receiver's last path component.
slots.createIfAbsent: Creates the directory (and any missing ancestor directories) if they don't exist. Returns self.
slots.moveTo(aPath): Moves the directory to the specified path.
slots.folderNamedCreateIfAbsent(name): Deprecated. Returns a new Directory object in the directory with the specified name.
slots.at(aString):
Returns a File or Directory object matching the name specified
	by aString or Nil if no such file or directory exists.
slots.directories: Returns a list of subdirectories in the receiver.
slots.exists(optionalPath):
Returns true if the Directory path exists, and false otherwise.
	If optionalPath string is provided, it tests the existence of that path instead.
slots.accessibleAncestors: Returns a list of accessible ancestor directories.
slots.isAccessible: Returns true if the directory can be accessed, false otherwise.
slots.fileNames: Returns a list of strings for the names of the files (no subdirectories) in the directory.

slots.cpuSecondsToRun(expression):
Evaluates message and returns a Number whose value 
	is the cpu seconds taken to do the evaluation.
slots.copy(aDate): Sets the receiver to be the same date as aDate. Returns self.
slots.isValidTime(hour, min, sec):
Returns self if the specified time is valid, otherwise returns Nil. 
	A negative value will count back; i.e., a value of -5 for the hour, 
	will count back 5 hours to return a value of 19. No adjustment is 
	done for values above 24.
slots.+=(aDuration): Add aDuration to the receiver. Returns self.
slots.secondsSince(aDate): Returns a number of seconds of between aDate and the receiver.
slots.asSerialization: Returns a serialization (sequence) of the date that allows for perfect reconstruction of the timestamp.
slots.setMonth(aNumber): Sets the month(1-12) of the receiver. Returns self.
slots.now: Sets the receiver to the current time. Returns self.
slots.secondsSinceNow(aDate): Returns the number of seconds since aDate.
slots.day: Returns a number containing the day of the month of the receiver.
slots.secondsToRun(expression): Evaluates message and returns a Number whose value is the number of seconds taken to do the evaluation
slots.isDaylightSavingsTime: Returns self if Daylight Saving Time is in effect for the receiver, otherwise returns Nil.
slots.convertToLocal: Converts self date from a UTC date to the equivalent local date
slots.format: Returns the format string for the receiver. The default is "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S %Z".
slots.asString(optionalFormatString):
Returns a string representation of the receiver using the receivers format. If the optionalFormatString argument is present, the receiver's format is set to it first. Formatting is according to ANSI C date formatting rules. 

	
%a abbreviated weekday name (Sun, Mon, etc.)
%A full weekday name (Sunday, Monday, etc.)
%b abbreviated month name (Jan, Feb, etc.)
%B full month name (January, February, etc.)
%c full date and time string
%d day of the month as two-digit decimal integer (01-31)
%H hour as two-digit 24-hour clock decimal integer (00-23)
%I hour as two-digit 12-hour clock decimal integer (01-12)
%m month as a two-digit decimal integer (01-12)
%M minute as a two-digit decimal integer (00-59)
%p either "AM" or "PM"
%S second as a two-digit decimal integer (00-59)
%U number of week in the year as two-digit decimal integer (00-52)
with Sunday considered as first day of the week
%w weekday as one-digit decimal integer (0-6) with Sunday as 0
%W number of week in the year as two-digit decimal integer (00-52)
with Monday considered as first day of the week
%x full date string (no time); in the C locale, this is equivalent
to "%m/%d/%y".
%y year without century as two-digit decimal number (00-99)
%Y year with century as four-digit decimal number
%Z time zone name (e.g. EST);
null string if no time zone can be obtained
%% stands for '%' character in output string.
slots.setYear(aNumber): Sets the year of the receiver.
slots.second: Returns a number containing the seconds of the minute(0-59) of the receiver. This number may contain fractions of seconds.
slots.setMinute(aNumber): Sets the minute of the receiver. Returns self.
slots.+(aDuration):
Return a new Date with the receiver's value plus an amount 
	of time specified by aDuration object to the receiver.
slots.asAtomDate: Returns the date formatted as a valid atom date (rfc4287) in the system's timezone.
slots.fromSerialization: Sets the date based on the serialization sequence.  Return self.
slots.isDST: Returns true if the Date is set to use DST.  Posix only.
slots.setGmtOffset: Set the number of minutes west of GMT for this Date's zone
slots.asNumber: Returns the date as seconds since 1970 UTC.
slots.setHour(aNumber): Sets the hour of the receiver. Returns self.
slots.isPast: Returns true if the receiver is a date in the past.
slots.setDay(aNumber): Sets the day of the receiver. Returns self.
slots.zone: Returns a string containing the system's time zone code.
slots.minute: Returns a number containing the minute of the hour(0-59) of the receiver.
slots.fromNumber(aNumber): Sets the receiver to be aNumber seconds since 1970.
slots.convertToUTC: Converts self from a local date to the equivalent UTC date
slots.today:
Set the receiver to the current date, no time information
	is included. See `now' for the current date and time.
slots.convertToZone(offset, isDST): Converts self to an equivalent data in a zone with offset (minutes west) and DST (true, false).
slots.month: Returns a number containing the month(1-12) of the year of the receiver.
slots.gmtOffset: Returns the system's timezone string. E.g., +1300 or -0500.
slots.gmtOffsetSeconds: Returns the system's seconds east of UTC.
slots.year: Returns a number containing the year of the receiver.
slots.-(aDurationOrDate): Return a new Date with the receiver's value minus an amount of time specified by aDuration to the receiver. Returns self.
slots.-=(aDuration): Subtract aDuration from the receiver. Returns self.
slots.setSecond(aNumber): Sets the second of the receiver. Returns self.
slots.isToday: Returns true if the receiver's date is today's date.
slots.asUTC: Changes the timezone of this date to utc
slots.clock:
Returns a number containing the number of seconds
	of processor time since the beginning of the program or -1 if unavailable.
slots.hour: Returns a number containing the hour of the day(0-23) of the receiver.
slots.fromString(aString, formatString): Sets the receiver to the date specified by aString as parsed according to the given formatString. See the Date asString method for formatting rules. Returns self.

DynLib.description: A DLL Loader by Kentaro A. Kurahone.

Same as call but for functions with no return value. Returns nil.
slots.setFreeFuncName(aString): Sets the io_free function name. Returns self.
slots.setInitFuncName(aString): Sets the initialization function name for the dynamic library. Returns self.
slots.open: Opens the dynamic library and returns self or raises a DynLoad.open Error if there is an error.
slots.setPath(aString): Sets the path to the dynamic library. Returns self.
slots.call(functionName, <arg1>, <arg2>, ...):
Call's the dll function of the specified name with the arguments provided. 
	Returns the a Number with the result value.
slots.callPluginInit(functionName):
Call's the dll function of the specified name. 
	Returns the result as a Number or raises an exception on error.
slots.isOpen: Returns true if the library is open, or false otherwise.
slots.path: Returns the path to the dynamic library.

Sequence.description:
A Sequence is a container for a list of data elements. Typically these elements are each 1 byte in size. A Sequence can be either mutable or immutable. When immutable, only the read-only methods can be used.

Terminology

  • Buffer: A mutable Sequence of single byte elements, typically in a binary encoding
  • Symbol or String: A unique immutable Sequence, typically in a character encoding

slots.bitwiseOr(aSequence): Updates the receiver to be the result of a bitwiseOr with aSequence. Returns self.
slots.containsSeq(aSequence):
Returns true if the receiver contains the substring
	aSequence, false otherwise.
slots.linePrint: Prints the Sequence and a newline character.
slots.escapeRegexChars:
Returns a clone of the receiver with all special regular expression characters
		("^", "$", etc) backslashed. Useful if you have a string that contains such characters,
		but want it to be treated as a literal string.
slots.greaterThanOrEqualTo(aSeq): Returns true if the receiver is greater than or equal to aSeq, false otherwise.
slots.removeOddIndexes:
Removes odd indexes in the receiver.
For example, list(1,2,3) removeOddIndexes == list(2). Returns self.
slots.pathComponent: Returns a slice of the receiver before the last path separator as a symbol.
slots...(aSequence): Returns a copy of the receiver with aSequence appended to it.
slots.*(aSeq):
Multiplies the values of aSeq to the corresponding values of the receiver 
	returning a new vector with the result.
	Only works on Sequences whose item type is numeric.
slots.urlDecoded: Returns url decoded version of receiver.
slots.bitCount: Returns the number of bits in the sequence.
slots.ceil:
Round each value to smallest integral value not less than x.
Returns self.
slots.uppercase: Makes all characters of the receiver uppercase.
slots.log10:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the base 10 log of its value.
Returns self.
slots.alignLeft(width, [padding]):
Example:

Io> "abc" alignLeft(10, "+") ==> abc+++++++ Io> "abc" alignLeft(10, "-=") ==> abc-=-=-=-
slots.pack(format, value1, ...):
Returns a new Sequence with the values packed in.

	Codes:
	
	*: (one at the beginning of the format string) declare format string as BigEndian
	B: unsigned byte
	b: byte
	C: unsigned char
	c: char
	H: unsigned short
	h: short
	I: unsigned int
	i: int
	L: unsigned long
	l: long
	f: float
	F: double
	s: string

	A '*' at the begging of the format string indicates native types are to be treated as Big Endiand.
	
	A number preceding a code declares an array of that type.
	
	In the case of 's', the preceding number indicates the size of the string to be packed.
	If the string passed is shorter than size, 0 padding will be used to fill to size. If the
	string passed is longer than size, only size chars will be packed.
	
	The difference between b/B and c/C is in the values passed to pack. For b/B pack expects a number.
	For c/C pack expects a one-char-string (this is the same as '1s' or 's')
	
	Examples:
	
	s := Sequence pack("IC5s", 100, "a", "hello")
	s := Sequence pack("5c", "h", "e", "l", "l", "o")
	s := Sequence pack("I", 0x01020304)
	s := Sequence pack("*I", 0x01020304)
slots.preallocateToSize(aNumber):
If needed, resize the memory alloced for the receivers
	byte array to be large enough to fit the number of bytes specified by
	aNumber. This is useful for pio_reallocating the memory so it doesn't
	keep getting allocated as the Sequence is appended to. This operation
	will not change the Sequence's length or contents. Returns self.
slots.escape:
Escape characters in the receiver are replaced with escape codes.
	For example a string containing a single return character would contain the
	following 2 characters after being escaped: "\n". Returns self.
slots.splitNoEmpties(optionalArg1, optionalArg: Returns a list containing the non-empty sub-sequences of the receiver divided by the given arguments. If no arguments are given the sequence is split on white space. Examples: "a b c d" splitNoEmpties => list("a", "b", "c", "d") "a***b**c*d" splitNoEmpties("*") => list("a", "b", "c", "d") "a***b||c,d" splitNoEmpties("*", "|", ",") => list("a", "b", "c", "d")
slots.sizeInBytes: Returns the length in bytes of the receiver.
slots.asXML: SGML extension to interpret the Sequence as XML and return an SGML object using SGMLParser elementForString
slots.+=(aSeq):
Vector addition - adds the values of aSeq to those of the receiver.
	Only works on Sequences whose item type is numeric. Returns self.
slots.removeEvenIndexes:
Removes even indexes in the receiver.
For example, list(1,2,3) removeEvenIndexes == list(1, 3). Returns self.
slots.asSGML: SGML extension to interpret the Sequence as SGML and return an SGML object using SGMLParser elementForString
slots.replaceSeq(aSequence, anotherSequence):
Returns a new Sequence with all occurrences of aSequence
	replaced with anotherSequence in the receiver. Returns self.
slots.asIoPath: Returns a Io style path for an OS style path.
slots.tanh:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the hyperbolic tangent of its value.
Returns self.
slots.containsAnyCaseSeq(aSequence):
Returns true if the receiver contains the aSequence
	regardless of casing, false otherwise.
slots.asBinarySignedInteger: Returns a Number with the bytes of the receiver interpreted as a binary signed integer. Endian is same as machine.
slots.meanSquare: Returns the arithmetic mean of the sequence's values after they have been squared.
slots.prependSeq(object1, object2, ...): Prepends given objects asString in reverse order to the receiver.  Returns self.")
slots.slicesBetween(startSeq, endSeq):
Returns a list of slices delimited by startSeq and endSeq. 
  Io> "" slicesBetween("<", ">")
  ==> list("a", "b", "/b", "/a")
slots.dotProduct(aSeq): Returns a new Sequence containing the dot product of the receiver with aSeq.
slots.rstrip(aSequence):
Strips the characters in aSequence stripped from the end of the receiver. Example: 
	
"Cut the tail off" rstrip(" afilot")
==> "Cut the"
slots.asNumber:
Returns the receiver converted to a number.
	Initial whitespace is ignored.
slots.fromBase(aNumber):
Returns a number with a base 10 representation of the receiver
	converted from the specified base. Only base 2 through 32 are currently supported.
slots.duplicateIndexes:
Duplicates all indexes in the receiver.
For example, list(1,2,3) duplicateIndexes == list(1,1,2,2,3,3). Returns self.
slots.**=(aSeq):
Raises the values of the receiver in the corresponding values of aSeq.
	Only works on Sequences whose item type is numeric. Returns self.
slots.asLowercase: Returns a symbol containing the reveiver made lowercase.
slots.afterSeq(aSequence):
Returns the slice of the receiver (as a Symbol) after aSequence or
	nil if aSequence is not found. If aSequence is empty, the receiver
	(or a copy of the receiver if it is mutable) is returned.
slots.clear: Set all values in the sequence to 0. Returns self.
slots.clipAfterStartOfSeq(aSequence):
Removes the contents of the receiver after the beginning of
	the first occurrence of aSequence. Returns true if anything was
	removed, or false otherwise.
slots.normalize:
Divides each value of the Sequence by the max value of the sequence.
Returns self.
slots.appendPathSeq(aSeq):
Appends argument to the receiver such that there is one
	and only one path separator between the two. Returns self.
slots.asClutterColor: Calls [[ClutterColor with]] with self as an argument.
slots.floor:
Round each value to largest integral value not greater than x.
Returns self.
slots.product: Returns the product of all the sequence's values multipled together.
slots.occurrencesOfSeq(aSeq): Returns count of aSeq in the receiver.
slots.asHex: Returns a hex string for the receiving sequence, e.g., \"abc\" asHex -> \"616263\".")
slots.distanceTo(aSeq):
Returns a number with the square root of the sum of the square 
	of the differences of the items between the sequences.
slots.interpolateInPlace(optionalContext):
Replaces all #{expression} with expression evaluated in the optionalContext. 
	If optionalContext not given, the current context is used.  Returns self.
slots.clipBeforeEndOfSeq(aSequence):
Removes the contents of the receiver before the end of
	the first occurrence of aSequence. Returns true if anything was
	removed, or false otherwise.
slots.asFile: Returns a new File object with the receiver as its path.
slots.withStruct(memberList):
This method is useful for producing a Sequence containing a raw datastructure with the specified types and values. The memberList format is:

list(memberType1, memberName1, memberType2, memberName2, ...)

Member types include: 

int8, int16, int32, int64
uint8, uint16, uint32, uint64
float32, float64
Example: 
pointStructSeq := Sequence withStruct(list("float32", 1.2, "float32", 3.5))
The output pointStructSeq would contain 2 raw 32 bit floats.
slots.-(aSeq):
Vector subtraction - Subtracts the values of aSeq from the corresponding values of the receiver 
	returning a new vector with the result.
	Only works on Sequences whose item type is numeric.
slots.asMutable: Returns a mutable copy of the receiver.
slots.beforeSeq(aSequence):
Returns the slice of the receiver (as a Symbol) before
	aSequence or self if aSequence is not found.
slots.translate(fromChars, toChars): In the receiver, the characters in fromChars are replaced with those in the same positions in toChars. Returns self.
slots.encoding: Returns the encoding of the elements.
slots.asBinaryNumber:
Returns a Number containing the first 8 bytes of the
	receiver without casting them to a double. Endian is same as machine.
slots.toBase(aNumber):
Returns a Sequence containing the receiver (which is
	assumed to be a base 10 number) converted to the specified base.
	Only base 8 and 16 are currently supported.
slots.tan:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the trigonometric tangent of its value.
Returns self.
slots.isMutable: Returns true if the receiver is a mutable Sequence or false otherwise.
slots.isUppercase: Returns self if all the characters in the string are upper case.
slots.asStruct(memberList):
For a sequence that contains the data for a raw memory data structure (as used in C), this method can be used to extract its members into an Object. The memberList argument specifies the layout of the datastructure. Its form is:

list(memberType1, memberName1, memberType2, memberName2, ...)

Member types include: 

int8, int16, int32, int64
uint8, uint16, uint32, uint64
float32, float64
Example: 
pointObject := structPointSeq asStruct(list("float32", "x", "float32", "y"))
The output pointObject would contain x and y slots with Number objects.
slots.makeFirstCharacterLowercase:
Receiver must be mutable (see also asMutable). Returns receiver. 
  Io> "ABC" asMutable makeFirstCharacterLowercase
  ==> aBC
slots.repeated(n): Returns a new sequence containing the receiver repeated n number of times.
slots.asOSPath: Returns a OS style path for an Io style path.
slots.exclusiveSlice(inclusiveStartIndex, excl:
Returns a new string containing the subset of the
	receiver from the inclusiveStartIndex to the exclusiveEndIndex. The exclusiveEndIndex argument
	is optional. If not given, it is assumed to be one beyond the end of the string.
slots.**(aSeq):
Raises the values of the receiver in the corresponding values of aSeq 
	returning a new vector with the result.
	Only works on Sequences whose item type is numeric.
slots.itemSize: Returns number of bytes in each element.
slots.endsWithSeq(aSequence): Returns true if the receiver ends with aSequence, false otherwise.
slots.findRegex(aRegexOrString, [startIndex]):
Returns the first match of the given regex in the receiver, after the given start index.
		If you don't specify a start index, the search will start at the beginning of the receiver.
		The method returns nil if no match is found.
slots.splitAt(indexNumber): Returns a list containing the two parts of the receiver as split at the given index.
slots.convertToItemType(aTypeName):
Converts the underlying machine type for the elements, expanding or contracting
	the size of the Sequence as needed. 
	Valid names are uint8, uint16, uint32, uint64, int8, int16, int32, 
	int64, float32, and float64. Note that 64 bit types are only available 
	on platforms that support such types. Returns self.
slots.asJid:
Converts Sequence to JID object. 
"cow@moo.com/Scandinavia" asJid
slots.alignLeftInPlace(width, [padding]): Same as align left but operation is performed on the receiver.
slots.matchesRegex(aRegexOrString): Returns true if the receiver matches the given regex, false if not.
slots.bitwiseAnd(aSequence): Updates the receiver to be the result of a bitwiseAnd with aSequence. Returns self.
slots.fromBase64: Returns an immutable, base64 decoded (according to RFC 1421) version of self.
slots.asin:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the trigonometric arcsine of its value.
Returns self.
slots.betweenSeq(aSequence, anotherSequence):
Returns a new Sequence containing the bytes between the
	occurrence of aSequence and anotherSequence in the receiver. 
	If aSequence is empty, this method is equivalent to beforeSeq(anotherSequence).
	If anotherSequence is nil, this method is equivalent to afterSeq(aSequence).
	nil is returned if no match is found.
slots.isLowercase: Returns self if all the characters in the string are lower case.
slots.size:
Returns the length in number of items (which may or may not be the number of bytes, depending on the item type) of the receiver. For example: 

	
"abc" size == 3
slots.copy(aSequence): Replaces the bytes of the receiver with a copy of those in aSequence. Returns self.
slots.replaceFirstSeq(aSequence, anotherSequen:
Returns a new Sequence with the first occurrence of aSequence
	replaced with anotherSequence in the receiver. If optionalStartIndex is
	provided, the search for aSequence begins at that index. Returns self.
slots.rangeFill:
Sets the values of the Sequence to their index values.
Returns self.
slots.mean: Returns the arithmetic mean of the sequence.
slots.removeSlice(startIndex, endIndex):
Removes the items from startIndex to endIndex.
	Returns self.
slots.makeFirstCharacterUppercase:
Receiver must be mutable (see also asMutable). Returns receiver. 
  Io> "abc" asMutable makeFirstCharacterUppercase
  ==> Abc
slots.cosh:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the hyperbolic cosine of its value.
Returns self.
slots.hash: Returns a Number containing a hash of the Sequence.
slots.removePrefix(aSequence): If the receiver begins with aSequence, it is removed. Returns self.
slots.foreach(optionalIndex, value, message):
For each element, set index to the index of the element and value to the element value and execute message. Example: 
	
aSequence foreach(i, v, writeln("value at index ", i, " is ", v))
aSequence foreach(v, writeln("value ", v))
slots.atInsertSeq(indexNumber, object): Calls asString on object and inserts the string at position indexNumber. Returns self.
slots.asList: Returns the receiver converted to a List containing all elements of the Sequence.
slots.asFixedSizeType:
Returns a new sequence with the receiver encoded in the 
	minimal fixed width text encoding that its characters can fit 
	into (either, ascii, utf8, utf16 or utf32).
slots.removeAt(index): Removes the item at index. Returns self.
slots.square:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the square of its value.
Returns self.
slots.unescape: Escape codes replaced with escape characters. Returns self.
slots.matchesOfRegex(aRegexOrString): Returns a RegexMatches object that enumerates all matches of the given regex in the receiver.
slots.replaceMap(aMap): In the receiver, the keys of aMap replaced with its values. Returns self.
slots.empty:
Sets all bytes in the receiver to 0x0 and sets
	its length to 0. Returns self.
slots.removeLast: Removes the last element from the receiver. Returns self.
slots.justSerialized(stream): Writes the receiver's code into the stream.
slots.Min: Returns the minimum value in the sequence.
slots.\/=(aSeq):
Divides the values of aSeq to the corresponding values of the receiver.
	Only works on Sequences whose item type is numeric. Returns self.
slots.removeSeq(aSequence): Removes occurrences of aSequence from the receiver.
slots.asJson: Converts to form that could be interpreted as json if it already contains json, e.g. {"aaa":"bbb"} --> "{\"aaa\":\"bbb\"}"
slots.bitwiseNot(aSequence): Updates the receiver to be the result of a bitwiseNot with aSequence. Returns self.
slots.asUCS4: Returns a new copy of the receiver converted to UCS4 (fixed character width UTF32) encoding.
slots.abs:
Sets each value of the Sequence to its absolute value.
Returns self.
slots.greaterThan(aSeq): Returns true if the receiver is greater than aSeq, false otherwise.
slots.isZero: Returns true if all elements are 0, false otherwise.
slots.percentEncoded: Returns percent encoded version of receiver.
slots.lowercase: Makes all the uppercase characters in the receiver lowercase. Returns self.
slots.sin:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the trigonometric sine of its value.
Returns self.
slots.asUppercase: Returns a symbol containing the reveiver made uppercase.
slots.sort: Sorts the characters/numbers in the array. Returns self.
slots.itemCopy: Returns a new sequence containing the items from the receiver.
slots.set(aNumber1, aNumber2, ...):
Sets the values of the receiver to the sequences of numbers in the arguments.
	Unset values will remain unchanged.
	Returns self.
slots.beginsWithSeq(aSequence): Returns true if the receiver begins with aSequence, false otherwise.
slots.asRegex: Returns a new Regex created from the receiver.
slots.logicalOr(aSequence): Updates the receiver's values to be the result of a logical OR operations with the values of aSequence. Returns self.
slots.isSymbol:
Returns true if the receiver is a
	immutable Sequence (aka, a Symbol) or false otherwise.
slots.unpack(optionalStartPosition, format):
Unpacks self into a list using the format passed in. See Sequence pack.
	
	Returns a List.

	Examples:

	s := Sequence pack("IC5s", 100, "a", "hello")
	l := s unpack("IC5s")

	s := Sequence pack("5c", "h", "e", "l", "l", "o")
	l := s unpack("5c")

	s := Sequence pack("I", 0x01020304)
	l := s unpack("I")

	s := Sequence pack("*I", 0x01020304)
	l := s unpack("*I")

	l := "hello" unpack("5c")
slots.byteAt(byteIndex): Returns a Number containing the byte at the byte index value.
slots.bitAt(bitIndex): Returns a Number containing the bit at the bit index value.
slots.findSeq(aSequence, optionalStartIndex):
Returns a number with the first occurrence of aSequence in
	the receiver after the startIndex. If no startIndex is specified,
	the search starts at index 0.
	nil is returned if no occurrences are found.
slots.setSize(aNumber): Sets the length in bytes of the receiver to aNumber. Return self.
slots.cos:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the trigonometric cosine of its value.
Returns self.
slots.lessThan(aSeq): Returns true if the receiver is less than aSeq, false otherwise.
slots.lastPathComponent:
Returns a string containing the receiver clipped up
	to the last path separator.
slots.findSeqs(listOfSequences, optionalStartI:
Returns an object with two slots - an \"index\" slot which contains 
	the first occurrence of any of the sequences in listOfSequences found 
	in the receiver after the startIndex, and a \"match\" slot, which 
	contains a reference to the matching sequence from listOfSequences. 
	If no startIndex is specified, the search starts at index 0. 
	nil is returned if no occurrences are found.
slots.+(aSeq):
Vector addition - adds the values of aSeq to the corresponding values of the receiver
	returning a new vector with the result.
	Only works on Sequences whose item type is numeric.
slots.sum: Returns the sum of the Sequence.
slots.with(aSequence, ...):
Returns a new Sequence which is the concatenation of the arguments.
	The returned sequence will have the same mutability status as the receiver.
slots.asSymbol: Returns a immutable Sequence (aka Symbol) version of the receiver.
slots.negate:
Negates the values of the receiver.
Returns self.
slots.capitalize: First charater of the receiver is made uppercase.
slots.splitAtRegex(aRegexOrString):
Splits the receiver into pieces using the given regex as the delimiter and
		returns the pieces as a list of strings.
slots.cloneAppendPath(aSequence):
Appends argument to a copy the receiver such that there is one
	and only one path separator between the two and returns the result.
slots.percentDecoded: Returns percent decoded version of receiver.
slots.isEmpty: Returns true if the size of the receiver is 0, false otherwise.
slots.split(optionalArg1, optionalArg2, ...):
Returns a list containing the sub-sequences of the receiver divided by the given arguments. If no arguments are given the sequence is split on white space. Examples: 
	
"a b c d" split == list("a", "b", "c", "d")
"a*b*c*d" split("*") == list("a", "b", "c", "d")
"a*b|c,d" split("*", "|", ",") == list("a", "b", "c", "d")
"a   b  c d" split == list("a", "", "", "", "b", "", "", "c", "", "d")
slots.strip(optionalSequence):
Trims the whitespace (or optionalSequence) off both ends: 

	
"   Trim this string   \r\n" strip
==> "Trim this string"
slots.appendSeq(object1, object2, ...): Calls asString on the arguments and appends the string to the receiver. Returns self.
slots.findNthSeq(aSequence, n): Returns a number with the nth occurrence of aSequence.
slots.asBinaryUnsignedInteger: Returns a Number with the bytes of the receiver interpreted as a binary unsigned integer. Endian is same as machine.
slots.setItemsToLong(aNumber): Sets all items in the Sequence to the long integer value of aNumber.
slots.asUTF8: Returns a new copy of the receiver converted to utf8 encoding.
slots.bitwiseXor(aSequence): Updates the receiver to be the result of a bitwiseXor with aSequence. Returns self.
slots.atan:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the trigonometric arctangent of its value.
Returns self.
slots.setItemType(aTypeName):
Sets the underlying machine type for the elements. 
	Valid names are uint8, uint16, uint32, uint64, int8, int16, int32, 
	int64, float32, and float64. Note that 64 bit types are only available 
	on platforms that support such types. Returns self.
slots.contains(aNumber): Returns true if the receiver contains an element equal in value to aNumber, false otherwise.
slots.setItemsToDouble(aNumber): Sets all items in the Sequence to the double floating point value of aNumber.
slots.inclusiveSlice(inclusiveStartIndex, incl:
Returns a new string containing the subset of the
	receiver from the inclusiveStartIndex to the inclusiveEndIndex. The inclusiveEndIndex argument
	is optional. If not given, it is assumed to be the end of the string.
slots.lstrip(aSequence):
Strips the characters in aSequence stripped from the beginning of the receiver. Example: 

	
"Keep the tail" lstrip(" eKp")
==> "the tail"
slots.max: Returns the maximum value of the Sequence.
slots.log:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the natural log of its value.
Returns self.
slots.asHTML: SGML extension to interpret the Sequence as HTML and return an SGML object using SGMLParser elementForString
slots.min: Returns the minimum value of the Sequence.
slots.asURL: Returns a new URL object instance with the receiver as its url string.
slots.clipAfterSeq(aSequence):
Removes the contents of the receiver after the end of
	the first occurrence of aSequence. Returns true if anything was
	removed, or false otherwise.
slots.acos:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the trigonometric arcsine of its value.
Returns self.
slots.lessThanOrEqualTo(aSeq): Returns true if the receiver is less than or equal to aSeq, false otherwise.
slots.logicalAnd(aSequence): Updates the receiver's values to be the result of a logical OR operations with the values of aSequence. Returns self.
slots.reverseInPlace: Reverses the bytes in the receiver, in-place.
slots.append(aNumber): Appends aNumber (cast to a byte) to the receiver. Returns self.
slots.whiteSpaceStrings:
Returns a List of strings. Each string contains a different
	whitespace character.
slots.setEncoding(encodingName):
Sets the encoding flag of the receiver (only the encoding flag, 
	itemSize and itemType will change, no conversion is done between UTF
	encodings - you can use convertToUTF8, etc methods for conversions). 
	Valid encodings are number, utf8, utf16, and utf32. Returns self.
slots.asBase64(optionalCharactersPerLine):
Returns an immutable, base64 encoded (according to RFC 1421) version of self. 
	optionalCharactersPerLine describes the number of characters between line breaks and defaults to 0.
slots.urlEncoded: Returns url encoded version of receiver.
slots.removeSuffix(aSequence): If the receiver end with aSequence, it is removed. Returns self.
slots.interpolate(ctx): Returns immutable copy of self with interpolateInPlace(ctx) passed to the copy.
slots.allMatchesOfRegex(aRegexOrString): Returns a List containing all matches of the given regex found in the receiver.
slots.*=(aSeq):
Multiplies the values of aSeq to the corresponding values of the receiver.
	Only works on Sequences whose item type is numeric. Returns self.
slots.asMessage(optionalLabel): Returns the compiled message object for the string.
slots.exp:
Sets each value of the Sequence to e**value.
Returns self.
slots.reverse: Reverses the ordering of all the items of the receiver. Returns copy of receiver.
slots.hasMatchOfRegex(aRegexOrString): Returns true if the string contains one or more matches of the given regex.
slots.atPut(aNumberIndex, aNumber): Sets the value at the index specified by aNumberIndex to aNumber. Returns self.
slots.at(aNumber):
Returns a value at the index specified by aNumber.
	Returns nil if the index is out of bounds.
slots.split Returns a list containing the sub-: If no arguments are given the sequence is split on white space.
slots.reverseFindSeq(aSequence, startIndex):
Returns a number with the first occurrence of aSequence in
	the receiver before the startIndex. The startIndex argument is optional.
	By default reverseFind starts at the end of the string. Nil is
	returned if no occurrences are found.
slots.sqrt:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the square root of its value.
Returns self.
slots.sinh:
Sets each value of the Sequence to the hyperbolic sine of its value.
Returns self.
slots.pathExtension: Returns a string containing the receiver clipped up to the last period.
slots.-=(aSeq):
Vector subtraction - subtracts the values of aSeq to those of the receiver.
	Only works on Sequences whose item type is numeric. Returns self.
slots.fileName: Returns the last path component sans the path extension.
slots.\/(aSeq):
Divides the values of the receiver by the corresponding values of aSeq 
	returning a new vector with the result.
	Only works on Sequences whose item type is numeric.
slots.asCapitalized: Returns a copy of the receiver with the first charater made uppercase.
slots.asUCS2: Returns a new copy of the receiver converted to UCS2 (fixed character width UTF16) encoding.
slots.isEqualAnyCase(aSequence):
Returns true if aSequence is equal to the receiver
	ignoring case differences, false otherwise.
slots.Max: Returns the maximum value in the sequence.

Compiler.description: Contains methods related to the compiling code.

slots.messageForString(aString, optionalLabelS: Returns the compiled message object for aString.
slots.messageForString2(aString): Returns the compiled message object for aString. (Runs raw string against lexer directly.)
slots.messageForTokens(aList): Returns the compiled message object for the given token list.
slots.tokensForString(aString): Returns a list of token objects lexed from the input string.

WeakLink.description:
A WeakLink is a primitive that can hold a reference to 
	an object without preventing the garbage collector from 
	collecting it. The link reference is set with the setLink() method. 
	After the garbage collector collects an object, it informs any 
	(uncollected) WeakLink objects whose link value pointed to that 
	object by calling their "collectedLink" method.

slots.link: Returns the link pointer or Nil if none is set.
slots.setLink(aValue): Sets the link pointer. Returns self.

Call.description: Call stores slots related to activation.

slots.relayStopStatus(arg):
Sets sender's stop status (Normal, Return, 
  Break, Continue etc.) and returns evaluated argument.
slots.resetStopStatus(arg):
Sets stop status to Normal.
  See also <tt>Call setStopStatus</tt>.
slots.evalArgs: Returns a list containing the call message arguments evaluated in the context of the sender.
slots.delegateToMethod(target, methodName):
Sends the call's message to target via the method specified by methodName.
		Returns the result of the message.
slots.setStopStatus(aStatusObject): Sets the stop status on the call.
slots.description: Returns a description of the receiver as a String.
slots.hasArgs: Returns true if the call was passed arguments.
slots.delegateTo(target, altSender):
Sends the call's message to target (and relays it's stop status).
		The sender is set to altSender, if it is supplied.
		Returns the result of the message.
slots.argCount: Returns the number of arguments for the call. Shortcut for "call message argCount".
slots.argAt(argNumber): Returns the message's argNumber arg. Shorthand for same as call message argAt(argNumber).
slots.coroutine: Returns the coroutine in which the message was sent.
slots.evalArgAt(argNumber): Evaluates the specified argument of the Call's message in the context of its sender.
slots.stopStatus:
Returns the stop status on the call. (description of stopStatus will 
	be added once we decide whether or not to keep it)

List.description: A mutable array of values. The first index is 0.

slots.removeFirst: Returns the first item and removes it from the list. nil is returned if the list is empty.
slots.indexOf(anObject):
Returns the index of the first occurrence of anObject
	in the receiver. Returns Nil if the receiver doesn't contain anObject.
slots.append(anObject1, anObject2, ...): Appends the arguments to the end of the list. Returns self.
slots.sortInPlaceBy(aBlock): Sort the list using aBlock as the compare function. Returns self.
slots.containsAll(list): Returns true the target contains all of the items in the argument list.
slots.removeAt(index):
Removes the item at the specified index and returns the value removed.
	Raises an exception if the index is out of bounds.
slots.insertAt(item, index):
Inserts item at the specified index. Raises an exception if the index is
    out of bounds. Returns self.
slots.union(list): Returns a new list containing items from the target and items which are only in the argument list.
slots.itemCopy: Returns a new list containing the items from the receiver.
slots.insertBefore(item, beforeItem):
Inserts item before first occurrence of beforeItem or to the end of the list if
    beforeItem is not found. Returns self.
slots.removeLast: Returns the last item and removes it from the list. nil is returned if the list is empty.
slots.justSerialized(stream): Writes the receiver's code into the stream.
slots.asMessage:
Converts each element in the list to unnamed messages with their cached result
    set to the value of the element (without activating).Returns an unnamed message
    whose arguments map 1:1 with the elements (after being converted to messages themselves).
slots.containsIdenticalTo(anObject): Returns true if the receiver contains a value identical to anObject, otherwise returns false.
slots.insertAfter(item, afterItem):
Inserts item after first occurrence of afterItem and returns self. If afterItem
    is not found, item is appended to the end of the list.
slots.rest: Returns a copy of the list but with the first element removed.
slots.reverseReduce:
Also known as foldr or inject. Combines values in target starting on the right.
    If no initial value is paseed the head of the list is used. See List reverse for examples.
slots.asJson: Returns JSON encoded representation of a List.
slots.difference(list): Returns a new list containing items from the target list which aren't in the argument list.
slots.shuffle: Randomizes the ordering of all the items of the receiver. Returns copy of receiver.
slots.copy(v): Replaces self with <tt>v</tt> list items. Returns self.
slots.contains(anObject): Returns true if the receiver contains anObject, otherwise returns false.
slots.reduce:
Also known as foldl or inject. Combines values in target starting on the left. If no initial value is passed the head of the list is used. 
Io> list(1, 2, 3) reduce(+)
==> 6
Io> list(1, 2, 3) reduce(xs, x, xs + x)
==> 6
Io> list(1, 2, 3) reduce(+, -6) # Passing the initial value.
==> 0
Io> list(1, 2, 3) reduce(xs, x, xs + x, -6)
==> 0
slots.reverseInPlace: Reverses the ordering of all the items in the receiver. Returns self.
slots.first(optionalSize):
Returns the first item or Nil if the list is empty.
	If optionalSize is provided, that number of the first items in the list are returned.
slots.join(optionalSeparator):
Returns a Sequence of the concatenated items with
    optionalSeparator between each item or simply the concatenation of the items if no optionalSeparator is supplied.
slots.atPut(index, anObject):
Replaces the existing value at index with anObject.
	Raises an exception if the index is out of bounds. Returns self.
slots.intersect(list): Returns a new list containing the common values from the target and argument lists.
slots.pop:
Returns the last item in the list and removes it
	from the receiver. Returns nil if the receiver is empty.
slots.remove(anObject, ...): Removes all occurrences of the arguments from the receiver. Returns self.
slots.containsAny(list): Returns true the target contains any of the items in the argument list.
slots.sort: Returns a new list containing the sorted items from the receiver.
slots.mapInPlace(optionalIndex, value, message:
Replaces each item in the receiver with the result of applying a given message to that item. Example: 
list(1, 5, 7, 2) mapInPlace(i, v, i + v)
==> list(1, 6, 9, 5)
list(1, 5, 7, 2) mapInPlace(v, v + 3)
 ==> list(4, 8, 10, 5)
slots.cursor: Returns a ListCursor for the receiver.
slots.asMap:
The reverse of Map asList: converts a list of lists (key-value pairs) into
    a Map. The first item of each pair list must be a sequence. The second item
    is the value.
slots.at(index): Returns the value at index. Returns Nil if the index is out of bounds.
slots.reverseForeach(index, value, message): Same as foreach, but in reverse order.
slots.anyOne: Returns a random element of the receiver or nil if the receiver is empty.
slots.sum: Returns the sum of the items.
slots.sortInPlace(optionalExpression):
Sorts the list using the compare method on the items. Returns self.
	If an optionalExpression is provided, the sort is done on the result of the evaluation
	of the optionalExpression on each value.
slots.empty: Removes all items from the receiver.
slots.removeSeq: Removes each of the items from the current list which are contained in the sequence passed in.
slots.prepend(anObject1, anObject2, ...): Inserts the values at the beginning of the list. Returns self.
slots.slice(startIndex, endIndex, step):
Returns a new string containing the subset of the receiver 
    from the startIndex to the endIndex. The endIndex argument
	is optional. If not given, it is assumed to be the end of the string. 
    Step argument is also optional and defaults to 1, if not given.
    However, since Io supports positional arguments only, you need to
    explicitly specify endIndex, if you need a custom step.
slots.sliceInPlace(startIndex, endIndex, step):
Returns the receiver containing the subset of the
	receiver from the startIndex to the endIndex. The endIndex argument
	is optional. If not given, it is assumed to be the end of the string. 
    Step argument is also optional and defaults to 1.
slots.select: Same as <tt>selectInPlace</tt>, but result is a new List.
slots.last(optionalSize):
Returns the last item or Nil if the list is empty.
	If optionalSize is provided, that number of the last items in the list are returned.
slots.unique: Returns a new list containing all the values in the target, but no duplicates.
slots.flatten: Creates a new list, with all contained lists flattened into the new list. For example: list(1,2,list(3,4,list(5))) flatten ==> list(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)
slots.with(anObject, ...): Returns a new List containing the arguments.
slots.swapIndices(index1, index2):
Exchanges the object at index1 with the object at index2.
	Raises an exception if either index is out of bounds. Returns self.
slots.preallocateToSize(aNumber): Preallocates array memory to hold aNumber number of items.
slots.size: Returns the number of items in the receiver.
slots.reverse: Reverses the ordering of all the items of the receiver. Returns copy of receiver.
slots.map: Same as <tt>mapInPlace</tt>, but returns results in a new List.
slots.foreach(optionalIndex, value, message):
Loops over the list values setting the specified index and value slots and executing the message. Returns the result of the last execution of the message. Example: 

list(1, 2, 3) foreach(i, v, writeln(i, " = ", v))
list(1, 2, 3) foreach(v, writeln(v))
slots.appendSeq(aList1, aList2, ...): Add the items in the lists to the receiver. Returns self.
slots.uniqueCount: Returns a list of list(value, count) for each unique value in self.
slots.selectInPlace(optionalIndex, value, mess:
Like foreach, but the values for which the result of message is either nil or false are removed from the List. Example: 
list(1, 5, 7, 2) selectInPlace(i, v, v > 3)
==> 5, 7
list(1, 5, 7, 2) selectInPlace(v, v > 3)
 ==> 5, 7
slots.fromEncodedList(aSeq):
Returns a List with the decoded Nils, Symbols and Numbers from the input raw array. 
	For each object reference encounters, objectForReferenceId(id) will be called to 
	allow the reference to be resolved. 
	
	Also see: List asEncodedList.
slots.average: Returns the average of the items.
slots.asEncodedList:
Returns a Sequence with an encoding of the list. 
	Nil, Number and Symbol objects are copied into the encoding, for other object
	types, referenceIdForObject(item) will be called to request a reference id for 
	the object.
	
	Also see: List fromEncodedList.
slots.sortBy(aBlock): Returns a new list containing the items from the receiver, sorted using aBlock as compare function. Example: list(1, 3, 2, 4, 0) sortBy(block(a, b, a > b)) ==> list(4, 3, 2, 1, 0)
slots.appendIfAbsent(anObject): Adds each value not already contained by the receiver. Returns self.
slots.shuffleInPlace: Randomizes the order of the elements in the receiver. Returns self.
slots.capacity: Returns the number of potential elements the receiver can hold before it needs to grow.
slots.detect(optionalIndex, value, message):
Returns the first value for which the message evaluates to a non-nil. Example: 
list(1, 2, 3, 4) detect(i, v, v > 2)
==> 3
list(1, 2, 3, 4) detect(v, v > 2)
==> 3
slots.atInsert(index, anObject):
Inserts anObject at the index specified by index.
	Adds anObject if the index equals the current count of the receiver.
	Raises an exception if the index is out of bounds. Returns self.
slots.setSize(newSize): Sets the size of the receiver by either removing excess items or adding nils as needed.

Error.description: An object that contains error information and flow control based on errors.

slots.ifError(code):
Evaluates code in the context of sender. Returns self.
Another form is Error ifError(error, code). Note: error slot is set in the context of sender, Locals object is not created!
slots.returnIfError: Returns self from the context of sender.
slots.with(message): Returns new error with message slot set.

System.description: Contains methods related to the IoVM.

slots.sleep(secondsNumber): Performs a *blocking* sleep call for specified number of seconds.
slots.thisProcessPid(): Return the process id (pid) for this Io process.
slots.daemon(dontChroot, dontRedirectOutputStr: Become a daemon process.  If dontChroot is false, the process will change its directory to /.  If dontRedirectOutputStreams is false, stdout and stderr are redirected to /dev/null.
slots.launchPath: Returns a pathComponent of the launch file.
slots.getEnvironmentVariable(nameString):
Returns a string with the value of the environment 
	variable whose name is specified by nameString.
slots.system(aString): Makes a system call and returns a Number for the return value.
slots.setMaxRecycledObjects(aNumber): Sets the max number of recycled objects used.
slots.iospecVersion: The version of IoSpec our IoVM is compatible with
slots.setEnvironmentVariable(keyString, valueS: Sets the environment variable keyString to the value valueString.
slots.symbols: Returns a List containing all Symbols currently in the system.
slots.runCommand: Calls system and redirects stdout/err to tmp files.  Returns object with exitStatus, stdout and stderr slots.
slots.activeCpus: Returns the number of active CPUs.
slots.maxRecycledObjects: Returns the max number of recycled objects used.
slots.distribution: Returns the Io distribution name as a string.
slots.getOptions(args):
This primitive is used to get command line options similar to Cs getopt(). It returns a map in containing the left side of the argument, with the value of the right side. (The key will not contain the beginning dashes (--).

Example: 

	options := System getOptions(args)
	options foreach(k, v,
	  if(v type == List type,
		v foreach(i, j, writeln(\"Got unnamed argument with value: \" .. j))
		continue
	  )
	  writeln(\"Got option: \" .. k .. \" with value: \" .. v)
	)
slots.installPrefix: Returns the root path where io was installed. The default is /usr/local.
slots.setLobby(anObject): Sets the root object of the garbage collector.
slots.exit(optionalReturnCodeNumber):
Shutdown the IoState (io_free all objects) and return
control to the calling program (if any).
slots.version: Returns a version number for Io.
slots.recycledObjectCount: Returns the current number of objects being held for recycling.
slots.ioPath: Returns the path of io installation. The default is $INSTALL_PREFIX/lib/io.
slots.args: Returns the list of command line argument strings the program was run with.
slots.platform: Returns a string description of the platform.
slots.userInterruptHandler: Called when control-c is hit. Override to add custom behavior. Returns self.
slots.platformVersion: Returns the version id of the OS.
slots.iovmName: The name of our IoVM as used by IoSpec
slots.launchScript: Returns the path of the io file run on the command line. Returns nil if no file was run.

Map.description: A key/value dictionary appropriate for holding large key/value collections.

slots.justSerialized(stream): Writes the receiver's code into the stream.
slots.asList: Converts a Map to a list of lists. Each element in the returned list will be a list of two elements: the key, and the value.
slots.values: Returns a List of the receivers values.
slots.empty: Removes all keys from the receiver. Returns self.
slots.select(optionalIndex, optionalValue, mes:
Creates a new Map with keys,values of self for which message evaluated
		to non-nil.
slots.asQueryString: Returns a urlencoded query string representation of this map
slots.merge(anotherMap): Returns a new map created by merging the pairs from anotherMap into this map
slots.map(key, value, message):
Create a List of results of message applied to self's items in a random
		order.
slots.hasValue(aValue): Returns true if the value is one of the Map's values or false otherwise.
slots.asObject: Create a new Object whose slotDescriptionMap will be equal to self
slots.reverseMap: Creates a new Map using values as keys and keys as values
slots.keys: Returns a List of the receivers keys.
slots.hasKey(keyString): Returns true if the key is present or false otherwise.

slots.at(keyString, optionalDefaultValue): Returns the value for the key keyString. Returns nil if the key is absent.
slots.asFormEncodedBody: Returns a urlencoded query string representation of this map
slots.atIfAbsentPut(keyString, aValue):
If a value is present at the specified key, the value is returned. 
	Otherwise, inserts/sets aValue and returns aValue.
slots.with(key1, value1, key2, value2, ...): Returns a new map containing the given keys and values
slots.foreach(optionalKey, value, message):
For each key value pair, sets the locals key to the key and value to the value and executes message. Example: 
	aMap foreach(k, v, writeln(k, " = ", v))
aMap foreach(v, write(v))
Example use with a block: 
	myBlock = block(k, v, write(k, " = ", v, "\n"))
aMap foreach(k, v, myBlock(k, v))
slots.mergeInPlace(anotherMap): Merges the pairs from anotherMap into this map
slots.atPut(keyString, aValue): Inserts/sets aValue with the key keyString. Returns self.
slots.isNotEmpty: Returns true if this map contains at least one pair.
slots.size: Returns the number of key/value pairs in the receiver.
slots.isEmpty: Returns true if this map doesn't contain any pairs.
slots.detect(optionalIndex, optionalValue, mes: Returns a random value for which message evals to non-nil.
slots.asJson: Converts a Map to a string that represents contents in JSON-compilant form

Blocks are anonymous functions (messages with their own locals object). 
They are typically used to represent object methods.

slots.message: Returns the root message of the receiver.

Returns the scope used when the block is activated or

slots.asSimpleString: Returns a short description of the receiver.

slots.callWithArgList(aList): Activates the block with the given argument list.
slots.profilerTime: Returns clock() time spent in compiler in seconds.
slots.print: Prints an Io source code representation of the block/method.

slots.setPassStops(aBool): Sets whether the receiver passes return/continue/break to caller.
slots.passStops: Returns whether or not the receiver passes return/continue/break to caller.

Sets the receiver's argument names to those specified in
	aListOfStrings. Returns self.

Activates the receiver in the target context of anObject.
	Returns the result.

If argument is an object, when the block is activated,
	it will set the proto and self slots of its locals to the specified

Debugger.description: Contains methods related to the IoVM debugger.

slots.debuggerCoroutine: Returns the coroutine used for the debugger.
slots.description: To start debugging a coroutine, call Coroutine currentCoroutine setMessageDebugging(true) Then each message sent within that coroutine will cause the Debugger vmWillSendMessage slot to be activated and the Debugger slots: messageCoroutine, messageSelf, messageLocals, and message will be set with the values related to the current message send. You can override vmWillSendMessage to implement your own debugging mechanisms.
slots.vmWillSendMessage: Override this method to implement your own debugging mechanisms. Default behavior is to print every message sent.

RegexMatch.description:
Contains the result of a regular expression match operation. It acts as a read-only list of captured strings. The first item is the entire matched string. Each item after that is a captured sub pattern (anything inbetween parenthesis in the pattern). 
Io> match := "37signals" findRegex("([0-9]+)([a-z]+)(!!)?")
==> RegexMatch: "37signals" 

# Item 0 is the entire matched string:
Io> match at(0)
==> 37signals

# Item 1 is the first capture ("[0-9]+"):
Io> match at(1)
==> 37

# Item 2 is the second capture ("[a-z]+"):
Io> match at(2)
==> signals

# The third sub pattern wasn't part of the match, so item 3 is nil:
Io> match at(3)
==> nil

# You can access captures by name, if you name them:
Io> match := "37signals" findRegex("(?[0-9]+)(?[a-z]+)(!!)?")
==> RegexMatch: "37signals"
Io> match at("number")
==> 37
Io> match at("word")
==> signals

slots.end: Returns the index into the subject at which the match ends.
slots.names:
Returns a list of the name of each named capture.
	If there are no named captures, the list will be empty.
slots.subject: Returns the string that this match was found in.
slots.asString: Returns a string containing a textual representation of the receiver.
slots.slice(startIndex, [endIndex]): Returns a new list containing the subset of the receiver from the startIndex to the endIndex. The endIndex argument is optional. If not given, it is assumed to be the end of the capture list.
slots.captures: Returns a list of captured strings. The first element is the whole match.
slots.startOf(indexOrName): Returns the index into the subject at which the capture with the given index or name starts.
slots.expandTo(templateString): Returns templateString with capture placeholders replaced with what they represent. $0 is replaced with the whole match, $1 is replaced with the first sub capture, etc. ${name} is replaced with the capture of that name.
slots.sizeInChars: Returns the length of the match, in characters.
slots.prefix:
Returns a slice of the subject string that contains all text before this match. Equivalent to: 
	match subject slice(0, match start)
slots.indexOf(name): Returns the index of the capture with the given name.
slots.select([index], capture, message): Like foreach, but the values for which the result of evaluating message are non-nil are returned in a list.
slots.regex: Returns the Regex that was used to find this match.
slots.foreach([index], capture, message): Loops through the captures, assigns each capture to capture, and evaluates message. Returns a list with the result of each evaluation.
slots.postfix:
Returns a slice of the subject string that contains all text after this match. Equivalent to: 
	match subject slice(match end)
slots.at(indexOrName): Returns the capture with the given index or name. at(0) is the entire match.
slots.ranges: Returns a list containing the range of each capture.
slots.rangeOf(indexOrName): Returns the range of the capture with the given index or name.
slots.nameOf(index): Returns the name of the capture with the given index.
slots.map([index], capture, message): Like foreach, but the result of each evaluation of message is returned in a list.
slots.range: Returns the range of the match in the subject.
slots.start: Returns the index into the subject at which the match starts.
slots.endOf(indexOrName): Returns the index into the subject at which the capture with the given index or name ends.

slots.foreachInterval(value, matchMessage, non: Like foreach, but takes an extra message that will be evaluated for the non-matching text before each match, and the non-matching text after the last match.
slots.splitString:
Splits the string being matched against into pieces using the regex as the delimiter
	and returns the piece as a list of strings.
slots.setString(aString): Sets the string to find matches in. Returns self.
slots.setPosition(aRegexOrString): Sets the search position to the given index in the string. Returns self.
slots.setRegex(aRegexOrString): Sets the regex to find matches in. Returns self.
slots.map(value, message): Like foreach, but the result of each evaluation of message is returned in a list.
slots.disallowEmptyMatches: Tells the receiver not to allow zero length matches. Returns self.
slots.position: Returns the search position as an index in the string.
slots.regex: Returns the Regex that the receiver uses for finding matching.
slots.foreach(value, message): Loops through the matches, assigns each match to value, and evaluates message. Returns the result of the last evaluation.
slots.string: Returns the string that the receiver finds matches in.
slots.allowEmptyMatches:
Tells the receiver to allow zero length matches. Empty matches are allowed by default.
	Returns self.
slots.replace(name, message): Replaces each match in the string with the result of message and returns the resulting string.
slots.allowsEmptyMatches: Returns true if the receiver allows empty matches, false if not.
slots.last: Returns the last match in the string.
slots.all: Returns a list containing all matches in the string.
slots.endPosition: Returns the index in the string where the receiver stops searching.
slots.next: Returns the next match, or nil if there is none.
slots.setEndPosition(anIndex):
Sets the index in the string where the receiver should stop searching. It will be as if the string ends at that index. If index is nil, the end position will be set to the end of string. Returns self. 
	Io> "funkadelic" matchesOfRegex("\\w+") setEndPosition(4) next string
	==> funk

	Io> "funkadelic" matchesOfRegex("\\w+") setEndPosition(nil) next string
	==> funkadelic
slots.anchored: Like next, but will only match at the current search position.

Regex.description:
The Regex addon adds support for Perl regular expressions using the PCRE library by Philip Hazel.

Example 1

	
Io> re := "is.*a" asRegex
Io> "This is a test. This is also a test." \
    matchesOfRegex(" is[^.]*a") replaceAllWith(" is not a")
==> "This is not a test. This is not a test.

Example 2

	
Io> "11aabb" matchesOfRegex("aa*")
==> list("a", "a")

Io> re := "(wom)(bat)" asRegex
Io> "wombats are cuddly" matchesOfRegex(re) replaceAllWith("$2$1!")
==> batwom!s are cuddly

slots.dotAll:
Returns a clone of the receiver with the dotall option turned on, or self if the receiver itself has the option turned on.

In dotall mode, "." matches any character, including newline. By default it matches any character except newline.

	
	Io> "A\nB" matchesOfRegex(".+") next string
	==> A

	Io> "A\nB" matchesOfRegex(".+" asRegex dotAll) next string
	==> A\nB
slots.names:
Returns a list of the name of each named capture.
	If there are no named captures, the list will be empty.
slots.multiline:
Returns a clone of the receiver with the multiline option turned on, or self if the receiver itself has the option turned on.

In multiline mode, "^" matches at the beginning of the string and at the beginning of each line; and "$" matches at the end of the string, and at the end of each line. By default "^" only matches at the beginning of the string, and "$" only matches at the end of the string.

	
	Io> "A\nB\nC" allMatchesForRegex("^.")
	==> list("A")

	Io> "A\nB\nC" allMatchesForRegex("^." asRegex multiline)
	==> list("A", "B", "C")
slots.isCaseless: Returns true if the receiver is case insensitive, false if not.
slots.asString: Returns a string containing a textual representation of the receiver.
slots.pattern: Returns the pattern string that the receiver was created from.
slots.captureCount: Returns the number of captures defined by the pattern.
slots.namedCaptures: Returns a Map that contains the index of each named group.
slots.extended:
Returns a clone of the receiver with the extended option turned on, or self if the receiver itself has the option turned on.

In extended mode, a Regex ignores any whitespace character in the pattern except when escaped or inside a character class. This allows you to write clearer patterns that may be broken up into several lines.

Additionally, you can put comments in the pattern. A comment starts with a "#" character and continues to the end of the line, unless the "#" is escaped or is inside a character class.
slots.version: Returns a string with PCRE version information.
slots.matchesIn(aString):
Returns a RegexMatches object that enumerates the matches of the receiver
	in the given string.
slots.isMultiline: Returns true if the receiver is in multiline mode, false if not.
slots.with(pattern): Returns a new Regex created from the given pattern string.
slots.caseless:
Returns a case insensitive clone of the receiver, or self if the receiver itself is case insensitive: 
	
	Io> "WORD" matchesRegex("[a-z]+")
	==> false

	Io> "WORD" matchesRegex("[a-z]+" asRegex caseless)
	==> true
slots.nameTable:
Returns a list with the name of each capture.
	The first element will always be nil, because it corresponds to the whole match.
	The second element will contain the name of the first capture, or nil if the first
	capture has no name.
	And so on.
slots.isExtended: Returns true if the receiver is in extended mode, false if not.
slots.isDotAll: Returns true if the receiver is in dotall mode, false if not.

Fnmatch.description:
The fnmatch add on adds support for the unix fnmatch function. 
(See fnmatch man page for details). 
Note: not all options are supported on all platforms.

slots.noEscapeOn:
If not set, a backslash character (\) in pattern followed by any other 
	character will match that second character in string. 
	In particular, "\\" will match a backslash in string. 
	If set, a backslash character will be treated as an ordinary character.
slots.caseFoldOn: Ignore case distinctions in both the pattern and the string.
slots.setPattern(aString): Sets the pattern string. Returns self.
slots.setString(aString): Sets the string to do matching on.
slots.periodOn:
If set, a leading period in string will match a period in pattern; where the location of ``leading'' is indicated by the value of FNM_PATHNAME:
  • If FNM_PATHNAME is set, a period is ``leading'' if it is the first character in string or if it immediately follows a slash.
  • If FNM_PATHNAME is not set, a period is ``leading'' only if it is the first character of string.

If not set, no special restrictions are placed on matching a period.
slots.hasMatch: Returns true if a match is found, false otherwise.
slots.pathNameOn:
If set, a slash (/) character in string will be explicitly matched 
	by a slash in pattern; it will not be matched by either the asterisk (*) 
	or question-mark (?) special characters, nor by a bracket ([]) expression. 
	If not set, the slash character is treated as an ordinary character.
slots.leadingDirOn: Ignore rest after successful pattern matching.
slots.string: The string to do matching on.
slots.matchFor(aString): Returns self if aString matches the pattern, otherwise returns nil.

SGMLElement.Representation: of an SGML / HTML / XML tag.

BigNum.description: A wrapper for GNU MP Bignum (arbitrary precision math) library. Warning: GMP uses the restrictive GNU license which can be a problem if you are hard linking it into a distributed application.

slots.pow(aNum): Returns power of receiver to aNum.
slots.nextprime: Returns next prime larger than the receiver.
slots.asSimpleString: Returns simple string representation of the receiver.
slots.asString: Returns a string representation of the receiver.
slots.hamdist(aNum): Returns hamming distance between receiver and aNum.
slots.root(aNum): Returns the aNum root of the receiver.
slots.%(aNum): Modulus op (same as mod()). Returns result.

slots.sqrt: Returns square root of the receiver.
slots.gcd(aNum): Greatest common denominator op. Returns result.
slots.lcm(aNum): Least common denominator op. Returns result.
slots.<<(aNum): Shift left (towards higher bits) op. Returns result.
slots.>>(aNum): Shift right (towards lower bits) op. Returns result.
slots.with(aNumber): Returns a BigNum version of the Io number aNumber.

slots.serialized: Returns a bit of code which can be used to serialize the Rational number.
slots.asString: Returns a text string representing the Rational number.
slots.compare(other): Compares two numbers against one another. Returns a positive, zero or negative value based on whether the receiver is larger, equal or less than the argument.
slots.!=(other): Compares two numbers against one another. Returns true if they are equal (represent the same number), false otherwise.
slots.asNumber: Converts the Rational number to a floating point number.
slots.==(other): Compares two numbers against one another. Returns true if they are equal (represent the same number), false otherwise.
slots.reduce: Reduces the numerator and denominator to their lowest terms.
slots.gcd(aNum): Calculates the greatest common denominator between the receiver and the argument.
slots.-(aNum): Returns the value of the receiver subtracted from aNum.
slots.asRational: Converts the number to a Rational number. CAVEAT: Numbers in Io are floating point entities, which means since they are imprecise, this conversion may yield values not expected.")
slots.abs: Returns a Rational number with the absolute value of the receiver.
slots.*(aNum): Returns the value of the receiver multiplied by aNum.
slots.divmod(aNum): Returns a list containing the integer value and the receiver modulus aNum.
slots.\/(aNum): Returns the value of the receiver divided by aNum.
slots.with(aNumerator, aDenominator): Convenience constructor. Returns a new Rational number whose numerator and denominator are represented by the arguments aNumerator and aDenominator respectively.")
slots.pow(aNum): Returns the value of the receiver to the power of aNum.
slots.+(aNum): Returns the value of the receiver added to aNum.

Random.description: A high quality and reasonably fast random number generator based on Makoto Matsumoto, Takuji Nishimura, and Eric Landry's implementation of the Mersenne Twister algorithm. The default seed is a xor of the ANSI C time() and clock() return values.

slots.setSeed(aNumber): Sets the random number generator seed to the unsigned int version of aNumber.
slots.flip: Returns a random bit as a true or false object.
slots.bytes(count): Returns a Sequence of size count containing random bytes.
slots.value(optionalArg1, optionalArg2):
If called with:
  • no arguments, it returns a floating point random Number between 0 and 1.
  • one argument, it returns a floating point random Number between 0 and optionalArg1.
  • two arguments, it returns a floating point random Number between optionalArg1 and optionalArg2.
slots.gaussian(optionalMean, optionalStandardD: Returns a pseudo random number between 0 and 1 with a gaussian distribution.

AVCodec.description:
An object for encoding and decoding audio and video streams.

When an input stream containing audio data is opened, the following slots will be set: 

audioChannels
audioSampleRate
audioBitRate
audioDuration
audioFrameCount
When an input stream containing video data is opened, the following slots will be set: 
framePeriod
videoDuration
videoFrameCount

slots.setCodecName(aSeq): Sets the codec name. Returns self. See: encodeCodecNames and decodeCodecNames
slots.decode:
Decodes the next chunk of input data. 
	Output (if any) is placed in the outputBuffers. 
	Returns self.
slots.encodeCodecNames: Returns a list of strings with the names of the encode codecs.
slots.decodeCodecNames: Returns a list of strings with the names of the decode codecs.
slots.close: Closes the input file if it's open. Returns self.
slots.path: Returns path to file the receiver is reading from or writing to.
slots.setStreamDestination(anObject):
Sets the streamDestination to anObject. The didProcess method will call: 
if(streamDestination, streamDestination write(outputBuffer))
outputBuffer empty
slots.setPath(aSeq): Sets the path to file the receiver is reading or writing to. Returns self.
slots.willProcess:
Called before the receiver will process more of the input buffer. 
	If inputBuffer is empty, it pauses the receiver's coro.
slots.write(aSequence):
Appends aSequence to the input buffer and resumes the receiver's coroutine in order to process it.
	The calling coroutine (inputCoroutine) will be scheduled to resume when didProcess is called.
slots.internalCoro: Returns coroutine used for the AVCodec to process data.
slots.setInternalCoro(aCoro): Private method for setting internalCoro. Returns self.
slots.videoCodecName: Returns the name of the video codec.
slots.codecName: Returns name of audio or video codec.
slots.open: Opens the input file. Return self on success or raises an exception on error.
slots.setInputCoro(aCoro): Private method for setting inputCoro. Returns self.
slots.inputCoro: Returns coroutine currently writing to the receiver.
slots.didProcess: Called after the receiver processes some more of the input buffer.
slots.isAtEnd: Returns true if the stream is at its end, false otherwise.

Oauth.description:
An object for calculating Oauth hashes. Each hash calculation should instantiate its own Oauth instance.

Example: 

digest := Oauth clone
digest appendSeq("this is a message")
out := digest OauthString

slots.setAccessKey(aSequence): Sets the access key. Returns self.
slots.setAccessSecret(aSequence): Sets the access secret. Returns self.
slots.setOauthToken(aSequence): Sets the oauth key. Returns self.
slots.setOauthSecret(aSequence): Sets the consumer key. Returns self.
slots.requestUrl(aUrlString, postContent): Request the given URL. If postContent is not provided, a GET request is sent. Returns self.
slots.setConsumerKey(aSequence): Sets the consumer key. Returns self.

slots.uuidTime: Returns a new time and mac uuid (type 1) in string format.
slots.urn: Returns the uuid with "urn:uuid:" prepended to it.
slots.uuid: Returns a new uuid in string format.
slots.uuidRandom: Returns a new random uuid (type 4) in string format.

MD5.description:
An object for calculating MD5 hashes. Each hash calculation should instantiate its own MD5 instance.

Example: 

digest := MD5 clone
digest appendSeq("this is a message")
out := digest md5String

slots.appendSeq(aSequence): Appends aSequence to the hash calculation. Returns self.
slots.md5String: Returns a string containing a hexadecimal representation of the md5 hash.
slots.md5: Completes the MD5 calculation and returns the hash as a Buffer. Once this method is called, append() should not be called again on the receiver or it will raise an exception.

SHA1.description:
An object for calculating SHA1 hashes. Each hash calculation should instantiate its own SHA1 instance.

Example: 

digest := SHA1 clone
digest appendSeq("this is a message")
out := digest sha1String

slots.appendSeq(aSequence): Appends aSequence to the hash calculation. Returns self.
slots.sha1String: Returns a string containing a hexadecimal representation of the sha1 hash.
slots.hmac(key, data): Returns a hmac signature sequence or nil on error.
slots.sha1:
Completes the SHA1 calculation and returns the hash as a Buffer.
	Once this method is called, append() should not be called again on the receiver or it will raise an exception.

TagLib.description:
Used to set meta data tags on the following audio formats: 
ape
flac
mp3
mpc
mpeg
ogg
Supports reading and writing the following attributes: 
title
artist
album
year
track
genre
And reading the attributes: 
bitRate
sampleRate
channels
length
Example use (load and modify a track genre): 
t := TagLib clone setPath("foo.mp3") load
writeln("genre = ", t genre)
t setGenre("ambient")
t save

slots.load: Loads tag data from the file specified in the path slot. Returns self.
slots.save: Saves the tag settings and returns self.
slots.path: Returns the path to the file.
slots.setPath(aSeq): Sets the path to the file.

slots.channels: Returns channels read from the audio file.

Read a given number of frames (sample pairs).
	Returns self.

Opens the file at the path specified in the path slot and sets the following slots: 
frames
sampleRate
channels

seekable
