Writes aSeq to the inputBuffer and yields until the 
	receiver is ready for more input data. Returns self.
slots.asyncWrite(aBuffer): Writes aBuffer to the audio output buffer and returns immediately.
slots.error: Returns an error string if an error has occurred, Nil otherwise.
slots.needsData: Returns true if the receiver can read more data.
slots.streamTime: Returns the audio stream time as a number.
slots.openForReadingAndWriting: Open audio output and input streams.

slots.process(sampleCount): Internal method used for processing a chunk of the input sources. Returns self.
slots.isRunning: Returns true if the mixer is running, false otherwise..
slots.stop: Stops the mixer if it is running.
slots.appendSource(aSource): Adds aSource to sources list. Returns self.
slots.removeSource(aSource): Removes aSource to sources list. Returns self.
slots.processedSamples: Returns the number of processed samples.
slots.start:
Start the mixer loop processing 1/64th of a second chunks
		by calling process(22050) in a loop.
		Will not return until stop is called. Returns self.

SoundTouch.description:
Used to change the tempo and/or pitch of an audio stream. 
	Input and output are in 32 bit floats in 2 channels at a rate 
	of 44100 samples per second.

slots.setPitchSemitones(aNumber): Sets the output increase in pitch semitones.
slots.setChannels(aNumber): Sets the number of input channels.
slots.setSampleRate(aNumber): Sets the input sample rate in Hz.
slots.process: Processes a chunk of the inputBuffer and appends the results to the outputBuffer.

OggStreamState.description: A wrapper around the libogg ogg_stream_state object.

slots.eos: Indicates whether we are at the end of the stream.
slots.setSerialNumber: Sets the serial number for this stream.
slots.packetout(packet): Outputs a packet to the codec-specific decoding engine.
slots.clear: Clears the storage within the Ogg stream.
slots.pagein(page): Submits a complete page to the stream layer.
slots.packetpeek(packet):
Provides access to the next packet in the bitstream
	  without advancing decoding.
slots.reset: Resets the stream status to its initial position.

OggSyncState.description: A wrapper around the libogg ogg_sync_state object.

slots.pageout(page): Outputs a page from the synchronisation layer.
slots.write(seq):
Copies the data from the sequence into the synchronisation
	layer.
slots.clear: Free's any internal storage and resets to the initial state.
slots.pageseek(page): Finds the borders of pages and resynchronises the stream.
slots.reset: Resets the synchronization status to initial values.

OggPage.description: A wrapper around the libogg ogg_page object.

slots.continued:
Indicates if the current page contains a continued
        packet from the last page.
slots.packets: Returns the number of packets in the page.
slots.granulepos: Returns the precise playback location of this page.
slots.version: Returns the ogg_page version that this page uses.
slots.setChecksum: Computes and sets the checksum for this page.
slots.eos: Indicates if the current page is the end of the stream.
slots.pageno: Returns the sequential page number for this page.
slots.serialno:
Returns the unique serial number of the logical bitstream
        associated with this page.
slots.bos: Indicates if the current page is the beginning of the stream.

OggPacket.description: A wrapper around the libogg ogg_packet object. No methods - used internally.

SampleRateConverter.description: A binding for libsamplerate useful for up or downconverting the sample rate of a raw audio stream. Streams are assumed to be in 32bit float interleaved stereo.

slots.process:
Process the input buffer to perform the conversion. 
	Returns self.
slots.setOutputToInputRatio(aNumber): Returns the output to input ration for the conversion.
slots.setEndOFInput(aBool):
Sets the end of input flag.
	Returns self.

Clutter.description:
Clutter is a GObject based library for creating fast, visually rich, graphical user interfaces.

Clutter works by manipulating a scene-graph of 2D surfaces, or 'actors', inside a 3D space.

ClutterActor is the base class for such surfaces. All ClutterActors can be positioned, scaled and rotated in 3D space. In addition, other properties can be set, such as 2D clipping, children and opacity. Tranforms applied to a parent actor also apply to any children. Actors are also able to receive events.

Subclasses of ClutterActor include ClutterStage, ClutterTexture, ClutterLabel, ClutterRectangle, ClutterEntry and ClutterGroup. ClutterActors are added to a parent, transformed and then made visible.

ClutterStage is the top level ClutterActor - it's the representation of a window, or framebuffer. It is created automatically when Clutter is initialised. ClutterStage is a ClutterGroup, a class implementing the ClutterCointainer interface.

ClutterTimelines provide the basis for Clutter's animation utilities. Multiple timelines can be synchronised using ClutterScore, and ClutterBehaviour and ClutterEffect allow for the creation of animation effects such as transitions.

Clutter further contains a number of utilities, including; ClutterScript - for loading 'UI definition' files formatted in JSON, ClutterShader - a class for applying GPU shaders to actors, ClutterModel - a utility class for MVC list type implementations, and fixed point math utilities.

For detailed docs, see clutter-project.

AppleSensors.description:
A singleton which on Apple computers can:
  • get and set display and keyboard brightness
  • read left and right ambient light sensors (laptops only)
  • read accelerometer sensor (laptops only)
Example use; 
	
sensors = AppleSensors clone
value := sensors getRightLightSensor

slots.setKeyboardBrightness(aNumber): Sets the keyboard brightness. Returns self.
slots.getRAMTemperature: Returns a number for the RAM temperature sensor.
slots.getPowerTemperature: Returns a number for the Power board temperature sensor.

Sets aVector to the current x, y and z accelerometer values. 
		Returns true on success and false on failure.

slots.getBatteryTemperature: Returns a number for the Battery temperature sensor.

slots.getGPUTemperature: Returns a number for the GPU temperature sensor.
slots.getRightLightSensor: Returns a number for the right ambient light sensor.
slots.getPalmTemperature: Returns a number for the Palm Rest Area temperature sensor.
slots.getKeyboardBrightness: Returns a number for the keyboard brightness.
